nl6FHAYO0IHcH4xDC6dp-g.text: Such a lovely place for afternoon tea. It was high on the list of best places to have tea so we chose it and packed our dressy clothes. The scones were indeed as light and tasty as everyone says, and the sandwiches and little cakes were nice, too. It was really busy so we didn't get water refills as often as we'd have wished.

VBhBFKjnQoZYd8E89pOxww.text: Great afternoon tea. The high tea and selection of tea leaves available is unrivalled in London.I didn't really want a big meal, so just wanted a pot of tea and a cake, but this isn't strictly possible, which is a let down. I think you have to go downstairs for that sort of thing.Anyway, I got a savoury dish (asparagus and a poached duck egg) which was amazing!!! It didn't say on the menu but it comes with truffles and truffle oil. It tasted out of this world!! My friend had a Welsh rarebit which was tasty too.After that I got a cake, a slice of the Bakewell tart. An issue at Fortnum's is that they do not give the best descriptions (such as omitting the truffles from the asparagus and egg). The Bakewell tart was an orangey thing, without jam. It was tasty, but not what I expected. Perhaps ask the waiting staff (who are very helpful, I had a nice chat with one of them in Spanish for a while) for a comprehensive description could aid your choice. My friend had the extremely rich chocolate cake which was great, not too sweet or bitter, perfect balance. It gets a bit too much towards the end.NB: although I'm not sure there is an enforced dress code, it is relatively smart, and therefore be more smart than casual when it comes to 'smart casual'.Enjoy

xqIX8dyBjSVHCAteQBdPRw.text: I really love the butter there!!!! But be aware of your personal belongings! I've been (nearly) stolen in the lift by two men.

E6qtu9CMrlVIRRph8GgzaA.text: The tables were set with fresh roses and beautiful pale turquoise china. There was beautiful live piano music.  However, the service was exceptionally slow and just sub standard for a place as well known and expensive as this, even though not all the tables were occupied. Even the coat check people didn't seem to know to give guests the priority vs dealing with a young waiter pushing a stroller in ahead of us as we waited for our coats!  The food, while tasty, is not good value for money and we felt that the Afternoon tea served at Kensington Palace Orangery restaurant was better tasting better service, and a better value for money. This was a once in a lifetime visit for us. We won't be back to F and M.

OVICrweF_EmsJ5Uky_0cAA.text: I am ashamed I didn't review this sooner.Fortnum and Mason is amazing. The store is amazing. I enjoyed our booking for tea right as the store opened so I had time to be the first person in there walking around without crowds.The food was great. And where you think you are done---there is more.They come around to "replenish" your plates if you want more sandwiches and scones.The tea was sadly the part I didn't like. I just stuck with an English Breakfast tea and the Royal Wedding as well.This is a really lovely setting for a nice lunch---- One may say this is pricey but the service is great, the food is almost endless and dressing up is optional...Yes. I went in blue jeans and trainers.

ld4URDZYUHtXRShANP8XBA.text: Before leaving the UK I knew I had to do afternoon tea and I would go all out to relish the experience. I booked an online reservation for two and addressed the dietary restrictions of the party. The food was sensational. The scones and sandwiches melted in our mouths. Besides delicious food the service was top-notch. My friend and I ended up staying here for five hours. Expensive but worth it.

vPzHpbU61koKFF9yCa0K6g.text: Your pocketbook only lives once, friend.Let's be honest -- you could get an equally fabulous high tea service elsewhere for far less money. But, if you have the money to spend, the service is absolutely divine, and it's not often you get to dine where the Queen has. So, there's that.

D6S47MDJheiGQ9jVHW2EVQ.text: Best afternoon tea service I have ever had! I am not a tea service expert but I did try it in Taipei and New York. I love British tea service. I am in London. Of course I have to try the real one in England. This place didn't let me down. It is amazing. The sandwiches are tasty. The scones are the best I have ever had. The apricot jam and lemon curd are delicious. They came in jars. They packed them up for me before we left. It is pricey and fancy but it's all you can eat. They will refill whatever you'd like which is awesome. This is definitely the top one place when it comes to the tea service for me. I would like to come back next time when I visit London!

photos.caption: Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom

R1akxpxYzgWaU-HVvOPOdA.text: I took a friend visiting from out of town. Hoping to indulge her in high tea, we took the short trip over to Fortnum and Mason! Everything from the greeting we received upon entering the tea are was top notch! The host was friendly and warm. She was also super helpful in helping us selecting teas. We each got the standards- tea sandwiches, pastries and the best scone/clotted cream and jam combo I've ever had! It was amazing.If you're looking for a place that makes you feel fancy, look no further! I'll be taking all my female friends and family who come to visit for afternoon tea here. Highly recommended.

p_DmGXWWAFpbpPQDFQAKsQ.text: Quite simply the best place for tea. I first discovered this place in 2012 on a visit to London and in 2015 my husband and I became engaged here over high tea. Naturally we returned this year to celebrate our marriage and hopefully will return regularly for years to come. The ambiance is perfect and the staff is amazing. The food never disappoints either.

29QOiB9N8zKoAranA2kVMw.text: This is a wonderful place. The tea was great, the afternoon tea for two was great. The service was awful.  We were forgotten about again and again.  Couldn't order, couldn't get tea, couldn't get water, couldn't get check.  For L10 I'd say it was fabulous but since it was 44L each or L188($300) for the 4 of us I'd say it was ridiculous.  Nobody should be treated this way at these rates.  We were even the smiling happy group but there is a point where it's just stupid for having wanted to enjoy some afternoon tea.  I'd say that we could do better at the tea shop in CA but that would be silly, true but silly.

3lln16PdD9lfrP8RkMjzHQ.text: The history of this place is what brought us here and I'm glad we came. As many other reviewers have noted, it's a all-you-can eat place which was very pleasant surprise. For the price (about $225 pounds for 4 of us), I thought it was a decent value given what you get. Overall, food was good and as expected. Servers were nice but not very attentive - we had to flag ours down to get more hot water for our tea and no one cleared any of our dirty plates nor offered new ones. I give this 3.5 stars but am rounding up because we did have a nice time and it is something one should do when visiting London.

x57qygh_YScNadUwukJ4Wg.text: Was left waiting for 30 minutes for a table because they couldn't find my reservation and did not bother to tell me when I arrived and said I had a reservation. Instead, the hostess kept saying it would just be a few more minutes. Waitstaff was polite and efficient although not very available. Tea itself was fine, with unlimited refills of both tea and the food, but somewhat overpriced at £45.

-XaPwqnG2jQMQDc23cO9nw.text: Perfect environment for high tea in London. Be sure to have a reservation and prepare to relax!

gwnNImkea-nIanwI94QzgA.text: You will need to dine twice at Fortnum and Mason when you are in London.  First to get the classic fish and chips at The Fountain (read separate review) and again to have High Tea at The Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon (4th floor).So make sure you allocate at least two hours so you can enjoy the atmosphere and the little savories, scones and cakes.  I started with a tea martini --- fantastic cocktail to start of the lazy afternoon.  A little bit on the sweet side and the alcohol is not that strong so don't get scared to get wasted in the middle of the afternoon.There are several menus to select from -- all my friends selected the Afternoon Tea menu where you start of with savory sandwiches, then scones then cakes.  I opted for the Savoury Afternoon Tea menu which I thought was a better selection.  I started with the same sandwiches -- the best were the cucumber with cheese, the salmon with horseradish cream, and the egg with mustard cress.  The winners in that 3-tier platter were the savoury scones: lemon & dill scone with smoked salmon and cream cheese on top and the pea and mint scone topped with Bayonne Ham.  I will definitely come back for these two scones.  Then finish of with the chicken liver and foie gras shortbread.  You can order the plain and fruit scones on the side if you want something sweet -- make sure you put a generous helping of the clotted cream and lemon curd or the raspberry jam.  It was a huge serving which is ok because you can take any leftovers and they beautifully wrap them for you.

dDv8JlZt9LMjC272b1Mpuw.text: I love to come here and shop for some gifts, but the real treat is the tea upstairs. This is one of my favourite afternoon teas in all of London. The sandwiches are nice and fresh, the scones are so good (and they just keep bringing them, it's so dangerous), and the pastries are lovely. If you have room after sandwiches, scones and pastries there is also a table with lots of cake options. Service is always top notch. I keep coming back.

vngyai8xeL6wlPji9I26KQ.text: I highly recommend reservation in advance. We made an online reservation and still had to wait a bit, and while waiting saw several parties being turned away because there simply was no slot available. Everything was delicious and generous in portions. They keep asking if you want more, and I wish I had the room in my stomach to eat all the food that was available. The sandwiches were a delight, as were the scones. I had strawberry black tea and my sister had apple green tea. Both were light and perfect for late afternoon caffeine fix. I only took off a star because I couldn't justify the price tag that came with this expensive tea experience, but everything (from decor to atmosphere to service to food) was perfect. Would probably not return, but it definitely is a one-of-a-kind experience that everyone should partake in at least once.

PDPhbeA-EngXjDaSljQUAQ.text: An awesome way to indulge in extravagance.  Something you just have to experience.  My wife and I hosted an outing for friends and family.  All were impressed and immensely satisfied with the delicious savory items and cakes.  Tea was quite good as well - what a selection!

IAL8CP-PAgUZMKFIWRcDpw.text: I wanted to love this. Really I did. We saw some good reviews on Yelp and decided that if we were visiting London, we'd have to do an afternoon tea. The decor was beautiful and the location ideal, as it was within walking distance to St James's park. They sat us and then we waited. Probably at least 20 minutes before we got a menu. We ordered the afternoon tea for 4 and standard  cups of tea. It was a full 25-30 minutes before we got any tea and that was only because the head waiter, I believe, finally asked us if we had ordered. It was quite a long time before the food came. The waitress informed us that we could obtain more of any part of the meal by just informing our waiter. I have to say, the food was pretty good. But paltry. We wanted to ask for more sandwiches but found it difficult as no one came to our table for over a 30-40 minutes. My hubby finally had to wave down the head waiter from across the restaurant again. Eventually got another bit, but by then we were soured. My son who was celebrating his 16th birthday would have loved more tea but even after 2 1/2 hours, there was no waiter to refill his water. After eating, we waited for more than another half hour to get a check. No waiters at any point to see how we were doing. Only at the very end to have us pay our check. We've had better, and more gracious high tea in California. Given that after tip, it was more than L180.00, I would have expected better service. Over 3 hours and only once did a waiter come to our table to give us our food. I don't know if there was a mix up on servers or perhaps they decided it wasn't worth expending good service on tourists. Won't be back on our next visit.

1yBTi-OUrx-TJlPTmacKIw.text: Recently enjoyed afternoon tea here, service was quite good and the food was terrific. Not that it wasn't exactly worth it... But, prices were a bit high for a tea and petit fours.                                                     My reccomendation: the normal Afternoon Tea for sampler (not the savory one mind you) with Queen Anne blend tea.

AKfKZIsWTQ0BSc2mfsqucA.text: Waitresses might change shifts quite often, or maybe it was just during our time, there were three hand overs. It was extremely hard to grab the attention of the waitress, which resulted in a half-hour-long wait for the tea menu. I can't say this was a pleasant experience.

TMn36LwXxyTLE0DmbNkLjA.text: I came for afternoon tea during my weekend trip to London! We got unlimited food and tea, which was so fun! The atmosphere was great. Everything is Tiffany blue, which is so fun! Also, the waiters were all extremely friendly and so helpful. We were unsure of which teas to order and he helped us pick ones based on our favorite flavors!Also, it's in a great location! Close to Hyde Park and SoHo!The jams/marmalades that came with the scones were incredible! I tried to bring the extra home with me, but they were more than 3 oz., so they got taken away at customs. I was so sad! I really liked the raspberry and lemon ones. The sandwiches were amazing! Egg salad, curry chicken... so yummy. Also, I loved he duck eclair. Such an interesting flavor!I really enjoyed this meal and would highly recommend Fortnum & Mason to any visitor who wants to experience a nice, quiet, traditional afternoon tea!

TP4Xqxn4S3iCFm0L4wTR7Q.text: If I can give 0 Star, I would.  Hostess welcomed you with an impatient frown.  We made reservation and the place was only 20% filled.  However, we got the worst seating of the entire restaurant.  I will never recommend this place to anyone and I will never come back here.  If you are willing to pay this $, you might as well go to the Mirror Room at Rosewood Hotel.  We went to the Mirror Room, great service, great tea and great food.

tvlJGp7jkDrdUaHo-y2Spw.text: Quick summary: expensive but doesn't live up to expectation. There are better places than Fortnum and Mason, e.g. The Wolseley. Come here only if you are crazy about the name like we used to. (We really loved it because of a childhood show All Creatures Great and Small)We paid £108 for slow service, unfriendly staff, poor quality sweets, cold tea, and forgotten tableFull story: My boyfriend and I were so excited about having a full and proper English afternoon tea in one of the most prestigious places in London - Fortnum and Mason. We looked up reviews online, we knew the price and such, we even went to the store the day before to check it out. We adore the shopping floors, especially the meat section. The staff there was so nice and explained different types of jerkeys with details. We ended up buying 800kg of all three types of jerkeys. Back to the afternoon tea. When we arrived, the front desk lady kindly explained the pricing and different sets of afternoon teas and high tea options. Afterwards, she showed us our table and let our server take over. We decided to have the sweet afternoon tea (£44) and the high tea (46£) which includes a main dish and savory scones and little snacks. The first round was great - we loved the main dish: Venison Wellington and the sandwiches were good as expected. However, everything turned down hill after the main dish. Our plates were emptied for a good 15mins but our server absolutely forgot about us. We asked two waiters to take away our empty plates and asked them twice for our tower of snacks and scones. We waited for 30mins until we have the two towers. It was quite busy that day but for that price and reputation we expected them to do better. Our towers finally arrived after 30mins. We loved the savory tower and the truffle puff was the best. But we were very disappointed about the sweet snacks. We didn't like anything on that plate. The flavor of the food can be very subjective since we all have different taste. However, the biggest turn off was the service. Our teas were cold, so we asked for a hot water refill. Again, we asked them three times until one lady answers us impolitely by saying "unhuh, unhuh". At this time, we were very upset about the experience. Our server totally forgot about our existence, other servers were unfriendly and unwillingly to offer help. The water came lukewarm - closer to room temperature. My boyfriend and I are tea drinkers and we tried different tea experience around the world. We have never encountered such unpleasant experience from a well respected tea place like Fortnum and Mason. In the end, we asked the staff to pack the sandwiches and scones. The server replied with a poker face: we don't pack sandwiches. And left with the remaining food without further explanation. We found out it's due to food safety reasons that we can't have the sandwiches as take away. But we only find out about it by asking the front desk. It also took us another 20mins and two waiters to get the bill. When the waiter came with the bill, we finally saw the first smile on his face :) This has ruined all the great impression we had before about Fortnum and Mason. Extremely disappointed. We paid £108 for slow service, unfriendly staff, poor quality sweets, cold tea, and forgotten table.

photos.caption: Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom. Savory and sweet towers
Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom. Venison Wellington

uQXT-M5ZHMKZP4vmL5tNAA.text: I was really looking forward to our afternoon tea at Fortnum & Mason however I didn't enjoy our experience as much as I wanted. Our waitress wasn't very pleasant, very brief - didn't ask if we had been there before or if we needed help selecting which afternoon tea we wanted or explaining the teas, not sure if it was something we did or if that is just how the service is. She kept checking my husband's level of tea which he was not drinking as fast because believe it or not we were not there for his benefit, so I went without tea for longer than I would have liked but waited patiently. She also didn't explain which sandwiches and tea cakes we received. It was very loud in the tea area both from the serving area where the teas are prepared and just generally loud groups around so not the tranquil, elegant experience I was hoping to have. In fact we could barely hear the piano over the noise level in the room. The scones were the best part in my opinion, husband liked the salmon sandwich. We enjoyed shopping downstairs and buying gifts to bring home but overall wish we would have selected another venue for our afternoon tea.

L7iW2b566TMjzVfBg2pdhA.text: The one thing the GF wanted to do in London was enjoy afternoon tea. So we decided to head to Fortnum & Mason's Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon after spending the day at Buckingham Palace.Fortnum & Mason is a huge department store located in London. They've obviously got everything you need for a proper tea, including a myriad of loose tea offerings for purchase. With respect to food, they've got specialty charcuterie, produce, and cheese as well.Located on the top floor, you'll find a pianist on the grand piano. And to your right, the tea salon beckons, ready to help you feel at home for the next few hours. Afternoon Tea [40 Pounds pp =  $65.56 pp]Afternoon tea is more than just the tea. It's about some pomp, along with some finger sandwiches and desserts to be enjoyed. From an entire menu of options, each person gets to select their own tea. Not to be crass, but did I mention unlimited refills? On everything.My green tea wasn't overpowering with ginger essence, but was lightly refreshing. We appreciated the tiny cubes of dried apple that imparted their essence into the GF's tea.But let's be real. I was here for the food. A tower of pastries, scones, and finger sandwiches came out. Along with clotted cream, strawberry, and lemon jams. The airiness of the rich clotted cream could not be denied.The raisin scones were like sweet biscuits, with a hard exterior that lent way to a fluffy interior. Perfect to pair with the lemon and strawberry jams.The sandwiches were sans crust and soft. Not much texture (even with the cucumber), but they were still enjoyable and classic. The cucumber sandwich was light, the salmon was smoky, and the egg salad was nicely seasoned with pepper. The roast beef was very good, but my favorite was the chicken and corn, which was well-seasoned and had sweet notes from the corn.I don't have much of a sweet tooth, but how could these tasty treats be denied? Eclairs, chocolate ganaches, cream puffs, and macarons. On top of that, don't hesitate to ask for goodies from the dessert trolley. We decided to try both the chocolate cake and raspberry lady finger cakes. The raspberry cake was moist and studded with cream, raspberries, and walnuts. The chocolate cake was extremely decadent - essentially a molded ganache. If you're a fan of chocolate, this is heaven.Service was very good as well - relaxed, well-paced, and proper without being pretentious. Some may poo at afternoon tea for those visiting London. But I say if you're looking to relax while enjoying some light fare and plenty of sweets, there's no reason you shouldn't consider spending your afternoon at Fortnum & Mason's Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon.

ptJQko1C_Dhl0xmQpdsUhQ.text: Like the environment and the tablewares they are using. The service was fine. The food tasted just average. The sandwich was dry, desserts are below expectation, jams are too sweet, but the scones are fresh and tasty, butter tastes good. I will say experienced it once is enough for the high price and it's famous name. I will come shopping but might skip the tea room.

qDUyH7A6A_r4IWUurCTETQ.text: We went here for high tea and had a fabulous time.We were very happy that they offered a vegetarian option.  The veggie sandwiches were all very tasty.  I, of course, loved all the desserts.  The scones were also scrumptious.  I highly recommend trying the lemon curd.The service was really on 4 stars.  The host was amazingly friendly, but our server was less enthusiastic.  Then he disappeared for about 40 minutes, luckily we had plenty of tea and nibbles to keep us busy.

Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom

chPgYKrg24vpNXamKLGoTQ.text: If it's worth doing, it's worth doing well and right. If you're going to have afternoon tea in England, you might as well have the best.The Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon atop Fortnum and Mason is hands down the best afternoon tea I've ever had (and I've had it in several different countries). I would go as far as to say that this should be in the top ten list of things you have planned for London, nay England.Things to know:- Call and make a reservation. Do not show up.- Dress casual but presentable. I wore a T-Shirt, jeans and sneakers but made sure none of it had stains or holes. I was still the most underdressed diner but they passed no judgement.- The steep price is worth it, especially when you factor in the refills on everything.Unlike many other tea rooms in the world where I felt judged for having afternoon tea by myself, the wait staff at the Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon made me comfortable. They were very attentive and returned to make sure my pot and my plate were full. They checked on me regularly to ask if I wanted to have seconds of anything (I did -- savory finger sandwiches) and made a good tea recommendation based on my preferences.Whenever I hear someone is visiting London, this the Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon is the first place I recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom. A sampling of the October 2015 afternoon tea options to get a sense of prices
Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom. A savory afternoon tea tier

wgrZvK0FfmKbSTSbvdB4tg.text: As an avid lover of afternoon tea, I booked several while in London for vacation. Fortnum and Mason was our first. The atmosphere was lovely, with robins egg blue accents, as was (most of) the food (smoked salmon sandwich was too dry, cake cart chocolate cake was overly dense, highlights were the coronation chicken, mini chocolate cake, and of course the tea), but the service was pretty poor. About half way through the tea, our server disappeared, never to be seen again. From then on, we had random waiters helping us after we waived them down. The woman next to us arrived after the server left, and waited about 20 minutes until someone took her order. When we did have service, it was very polite and responsive, but we had to flag down staff, which was less than ideal. Don't know if we got a bum waiter or what, but it certainly could have been better.

ZzSN7Rdg5foVSajY1OTEhw.text: When in London, a visit to Fortunm's is obligatory and if afternoon tea is involved even better! Everything was perfect, the service was impeccable, our waiter   was very attentive and nice and refilled our glasses constantly and our plates were refreshed constantly. The food is as good as you would expect, the tea sandwiches were nice and assorted, the coronation chicken was my favorite. The scones fresh and the clotted cream sumptuous with a dollop of jam or lemon curd.They also offer mignons like mini rose eclairs and chocolate cake. As one would think, the tea is their forte, the selection is long and the waiters can help you decide depending on your taste. I kept it simple with the house blend and it was very nice.At the end the waiter came around with a slice of Victoria sponge with berries that was scrumptious! If I had to criticize anything, it would be the evident chips and scratches in the china and cutlery, other than that perfect.

GSkKBEbrLmdyUsiz1_u3Iw.text: Totally overrated and over priced.The environment was nice for sure. All the service was good and the waiters were all friendly. I ordered high tea with Jubilee. Scollop was great. Scone was good. Butter spread was good.The sandwich and desert were very disappointing, very sorry to say. None of the desert is good.For the quality of the food that we get, I would say it's overrated....

8vVK04W2f1-kwXNnW01E3g.text: We were so delighted to bring our children for a proper tea at Fortnum and Mason. It was an incredible meal and a highlight of our trip. The food was incredible (we liked things we usually don't like), the sweets were gorgeous and delicious, and the tea, extraordinary. The best part is the traditional scones, clotted cream and jam. We'd be happy just having those with tea, quite honestly. Our servers were professional, courteous and warm. As other reviewers have said, you MUST get the chocolate cake from the sweets table. It is one of the best you will ever have in your life. While there were many people in the rooms, we felt like we were the only people there and the piano music in the distance was calm and classy.I took off one star for:* Our table wasn't ready on time. While it was Good Friday and extremely busy, we arrived hungry and waited nearly 15 minutes for our reserved table to be ready.* My younger child was handed a child's menu without asking. While her age is appropriate for normal pizza and macaroni & cheese eating kids, it's not the case with this one and she continually feels put down by not being offered the adult menu.  She ended up ordered the vegetarian tea and loving it.* There's simply too much food. My husband and I shared a single tray and we were stuffed. One wants to get the most for the price but even splitting the four of us couldn't finish a tiny piece of chocolate cake from the dessert table. I'm a baker and I longed to try the raspberry coconut cake and the pear tart.  I saw piles upon piles of food leaving tables that people couldn't or didn't want to finish. It seems like a terrible waste. These are minor points in the overall experience we had. That was our last night in London and a wonderful way to end our trip. Go, go, go!!

37gxHqefcYEAMSH0JRpBLQ.text: Fantastic experience and superb customer service by one waitperson in particular (didn't catch name)Did not know it was all you can eat/order. always a plus. But by the time we finished on section we were nearly stuffed. There was a separate cake area to plate later.The wait person was incredibly attentive- and encouraged us to order more, and then boxed up cakes for us to go--- didn't even need to ask him that (wouldn't think we could have either).Since we are US tourist-- also gave us directions to nearby events and recommendations. Very friendly and appropriately chatty. Area is clean and bright. The sandwiches were better than the sweets. Highly recommended for tourists for the afternoon tea experience.

gS9fA0hmwCe4MMGaWoDWYA.text: TL;DR: It gets two stars for the delicious food and tea, but the service was absolutely awful.Dining at Fortnum & Mason's was one of the things to which I was looking forward the most on my first trip to London. I wanted to have a truly British tea and made reservations for my husband and me for 5:00 PM on 18 March several months in advance. When we arrived at the salon, we had to wait 15 minutes to be seated. This was not an issue, and we were fine to wait in the reception. When we were seated, no one approached us for a few minutes until a man brought over a pitcher of water to fill our glasses. We assumed he was a busboy at first as he never introduced himself, and it wasn't until he asked if we'd made any decisions on the menu or had any questions that we realized he would be our waiter. He was not particularly helpful in advising me on teas, which I found disappointing as I was planning to ask for suggestions since I am a relative neophyte. (I drink some tea at home but not significant amounts.) My husband and I ordered the high tea and savory afternoon tea with our first two pots, and everything seemed to go well for a while. I'm unsure whether we did something offensive during the service (though we could think of nothing), but our server practically ignored us throughout the entire meal. I sat with an empty water glass for 40 minutes, and though I saw him refilling cups around us, he ignored my table and seemed to forget we were there. We managed to flag him down after being out of tea for approximately 15 minutes and requested the new pots he had said we could have. It took a significant amount of time to receive them, and when they finally did come, we decided to put in our cake order since we weren't sure when we'd see him again. He tried to clear my plate, which still had food on it, without asking whether I had finished, and when I protested, he said he couldn't bring the cake until I'd finished the savory items. I completed the course shortly after he left, and we waited for 30 minutes for the cake we had ordered to arrive. It never did.At this point we had been in the restaurant 2 hours though I had been told through e-mail to expect the service to last only 1.5. I excused myself to the facilities, and when I returned, my husband told me he had finally managed to grab the attention of another server, who sent our waiter to the table. Apparently he had completely forgotten about us and our order, which led me to wonder what we thought we were doing for 30 minutes with nothing but dirty dishes on our table. He ended up packing the cakes up for us to take home since we had been there such a long time and were frankly ready to be gone after being ignored for hours. I was incredibly disappointed with the whole episode and left the salon truly upset about the way we had been treated. I didn't speak to management then because I was so shocked at the abysmal service after reading nothing but glowing reviews and anticipating this visit for months. I wrote to the restaurant at the reservation link and was told that the restaurant manager would respond within 72 hours; it's been 9 days now so I'm not holding my breath for a response.This was not what I expected from such a well-respected establishment. I would never return again (despite the amazing food and drink); what was supposed to be a highlight of my trip ended up being nothing more than an expensive, disappointing experience.

ohTn4DrXE1hlAMf-x-ePFg.text: My hubby and I were looking forward to enjoy afternoon tea and savoy tea at F&M. We had them, however we're really disappointed their poor quality service.They have great tea selection. My hubby asked to refill tea. It took over 30 minutes. He asked different flavor of tea to refill. But they did not change the cup. He asked to change the cup. It took another 10 minutes to bring new cup. The tea stewed and became too strong. They did not serve the tea proper timing.They were not forthcoming to replenish the tea. They rush us to leave less than 2 hours. Almost half of tables were empty. I supposed they were not busy. They offered that we could take away leftovers. However, the waiter was wrapped roughly. The waiter put the pastries on the apple tart. When I opened the box at hotel, those pastries were messed up.We paid about £100 for afternoon tea and savoy tea. Savoy plate and clotted cream are delicious. But scones and sandwiches are average. Pastries are too sweet. I suppose it's overpriced. Especially their unprofessional service is not worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom

_ma91ROZEUXKG8qhsuCzyA.text: Best tea I ever had ! Must make a reservation in advance. Service was great at first then it got busy and service went down a bit but they're nice . But the tea and food is very delicious the atmosphere is gorgeous traditional but updated traditional (but granny traditional) I also went to the ring at the shard and other teas but this is the best traditional tea you'll ever had you can see my reviews on my site rosiovaldez.con

3alCGSTFVl3ZhPAv70Ri_g.text: The most unpleasant afternoon tea experience ever! First, we were 10 minutes late being seated when we showed up 5 minutes before our reservation. After we sat down, no one came to take our order for 20 minutes. No one came by to give us water even. Then we had to flag down the captain to take our order. Finally, someone brought us our tea and food with some kind of attitude. Excuse me? The food is at most at par. The chocolate cake had no flavor and the sandwiches were dry around the edges so they probably say around for sometime. Go somewhere if you are looking for more civilized and pleasant English tea experience,

mNvJARI9ZgLdXJdGNPlMzA.text: With this price I paid, thought the experience would be much more valuable.I booked it over a month ahead, but we were put by the entrance because no other two ppl seat available. As you can imagine, staff rushed pass us frequently. We felt it very clearly because its old wooden floor.Tea had nothing to pick on. It was great, but not distinctively great.Sandwiches were lame comparing to other places. Bread was dry. Ingredients were so so. Raspberry jam with warm scone were the only spark we had.Decor and setting shows history in the positive way.Still I leave a 3 star with the poor quality on food taste under this price.

JqSAsRO5tsxxGH57LXwxuA.text: Before my trip to London, I went all out crazy looking for the best place for afternoon tea. With so many choices in the city and a range of prices from £20 to £60 or more per person, it was hard to pick one, but we ultimately settled for this one. We were skeptical and had high expectations due to the price - £40pp for the regular Afternoon tea with one of the classic tea blends. This is our first time at one of these places so we didn't quite know what to expect. Our waiter was quite helpful at guiding, explaining about the menu and answering all our questions.1. Your table is guaranteed for 90 mins. We stayed for almost 2 hours though because we started at 530pm and I think it ends at 7pm. Plus it was not overly packed on the Friday that we went.2. Everyone at your table can order different sets. ie) You can have the regular afternoon tea while someone else can order the savory afternoon tea. 3. Each plate level is replenishable. You just have to ask. It isn't advertised.4. You can have as many pots of tea as you want. If you didn't finish a pot and it turns cold, just ask and they will give you another. If you want to try a different tea blend, you can as well. It's unlimited. 5. At the end, you can also have some cakes/pies from the cake carriage. We tried the raspberry cake and it was absolutely divine.6. If you didn't finish something and you want to take it home, they can box it up for you. That includes the cakes at the end even if you didn't get a chance to eat them because you are too full. That's what we did. However, we couldn't box up our finger sandwiches due to a food regulation according to our waiter. Now on to our teas and food. I picked the Countess Grey blend and my bf picked the Queen Anne Blend. Both were very good but I really LOVED the Countess Grey. The light orange flavor you taste was very pleasant. All of the finger sandwiches were tasty and fresh. The scones were great as well as the clotted cream, raspberry jam and the lemon curd. Some of the sweets were too sweet for our liking like the eclair, but the others were delicious. It was a bit pricey, but it was a fantastic, classy experience overall and something everyone should try at least once in their lifetime.

photos.caption: Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom. Countess Grey Blend was such a good flavored tea w/ hint of orange. Also love the color and look of the china
Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom. Afternoon Tea

XUiXQHoaDF69u3qbdXCsvw.text: Very cute and proper tea room. The prices are reasonable for afternoon tea starting at £44 without alcohol. I didn't feel like it was pretentious at all. The staff was helpful. You can also order more of anything you want for your menu! We opted for the savory afternoon tea. The chicken finger sandwiches were delish, the savory scones were good but very heavy and dense. Stilton cheese was a main component of one. If you enjoy cheese stink, then this one is for you. We also enjoyed the foie gras eclair, salmon bini with caviar, and game terrine were our favorites.

photos.caption: Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom. Tea and savory snacks

j1DjnLdBz4s2ulnu19PTmw.text: This was a wonderful experience! The staff was very patient and explained to us first time visitors how afternoon tea worked. The setting and presentation was elegant and the food was delicious. Highly recommended!

photos.caption: Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom. Elegant and delicious!

mJeoQZ343psZFbYGpVTbQQ.text: On our trip to London, I had to try a traditional Afternoon Tea.  After much research, I decided to go with a classic - Fortnum and Mason.  I had no idea it was an actual sort of department store.  The main floor was of course, tea.  I bought Earl Gray for myself (the best Earl Gray tea I have ever had) and green tea in a special Fortnum container.  The other floors had clothing and accessories, but we went up to the Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon, which was opened by Her Majesty.  Ohh la la!  They have a High Tea, Champagne Tea, Traditional Afternoon Tea, Savory Afternoon Tea, and Vegetarian Tea.  We did one Traditional and one Savory, which is 46 pounds per person or 50 pounds if you pick a rare tea.  I got the Moroccan Mint tea, which was very refreshing. Some of the highlights of our tiered tea towers were the Coronation Turkey and Fortnum's Smoke Salmon finger sandwiches, the wild mushroom puff with truffle, and parfait of goose foie gras eclair with port glaze.  But the best thing, was the scones with clotted cream and jam.  Omg.  They needed to be taken away from me.  I definitely liked the Savory tea better, as the desserts were a bit too sweet and we couldn't even get ourselves to try anything from the cake carriage, which is basically a table of cakes you can grab as much as you want from.  Did I note they will refill your food with any specific items you like?? Heaven! If you want to try a classic English Afternoon Tea, definitely check out Fortnum's and plan to stay for at least and hour and a half to 2 hours to fully enjoy!

L-FP67n4-XcU2MIGrS6K7Q.text: High tea at Fortnum and Mason was the highlight of our trip. I made a reservation weeks in advance and was glad I did. Our server was very accommodating of our American ways and graciously led us through the menu choices and the tea selection. We all tried different types of tea and had fun going downstairs to the food hall after tea and buying some to take home. They generously refilled our tiered trays multiple times so everyone could try everything. We were pretty stuffed when it came time for the cake trolley, so they made us a beautiful to-go box of cake samples which we enjoyed in our room later that evening. Definitely recommend.

l_uSJEkiHuUc8WBzFFL0CA.text: Great spot for that sort of ultimate fancy tea experience, and the price does reflect that. The setting was extremely nice, service was impeccable, and the tea and food selections were all great. All of the other patrons there were clearly celebrating something -- birthdays, anniversaries, etc. -- and though I'd dropped in without a reservation and was actually pretty under-dressed, they were super polite and helpful and managed to accommodate me (though I wouldn't expect this -- I got there just as they opened and heard them turn away other walk-ins right after me). The piano player was great, and the whole experience was very pleasant and relaxed.

BcsVVBDaIl4Mlh_JMU30Tg.text: We had a wonderful experience having tea.  We had 2 adults and 1 child in our party.  The ambiance is very classy.  We had one savory, one sweet, and a children's tea.  They will keep refilling your plates so if you order different menus then you can try a little bit of everything.  Our server was charming and attentive.  The clotted cream was divine as we're the scones and finger sandwiches.  Be sure to browse through the store downstairs.

photos.caption: Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom. Dessert table
Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom. Children's tea
Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom. Sweet and savory plates

0lgB3DnQ32Rq1yI-m1Kk6A.text: We had reservations for tea in London at 4pm.  There were some people in line waiting to go in. But once we got to the front of the line, we were immediately seated.  The service was ok.  Our waitress was sweet and checked on us regularly.  We ended staying for about 2 hours without anyone rushing us at all.  As for the food, presentation was very nice.  We ordered a sweet and a savory tea set and both were great.  The food items were bite sized and just the right portion.  They give you refills on any item you wish.  We didn't finish out sandwiches which were in the bottom rack and asked to get it in a take away.  Our take away was neatly boxes in a pretty blue box.  But sadly when we got to our hotel,  we realized they weren't in there--so we can't comment on the taste of the sandwiches.

JoW4L-i8egS3k0qPmpvvJw.text: Fortnum and Mason is one of my favourite tea brands in the world, so I had high hopes for their Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon. I was not disappointed, at least not with the tea or food. My friend and I had reservations, and after a short wait in the reception area, we were seated near the cake carriage.The service was adequate, though I must say it could have been friendlier. We were there for the full afternoon tea service and our server was a bit cold and abrupt, if not outright rude. The tea was fantastic, as I expected. The scones and clotted cream were fresh, and we were presented with two jars of jam and lemon curd. The sandwiches were good and plentiful.The server at the cake carriage was much better, and I particularly liked the Battenberg cake. It was fresh out of their bakery and was quite good: moist and not too sweet. It was not a busy afternoon and we were able to take our time in the salon. It was mostly a pleasant experience and I'll give them another try when I'm back in London this summer.

photos.caption: Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom. Individual patisserie.
Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom. Battenberg cake.
Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom. Afternoon tea.

zh0tbzigiYfKKMS3Ahrkdw.text: Such a satisfying afternoon tea! They kept refilling our food and tea, and I ended up trying three different teas. Super friendly wait staff.

8IpLBbZdspnOns4tAQum3w.text: High tea was a highlight of my trip. I chose the classic and had both savory sandwiches and the sweets. The scones with clotted cream were so addicting! My chai tea and added champagne were also excellent, some of the best quality champagne I had on our trip. I was really excited to find a high tea place that offered an entire selection of gluten free items for my husband. I wish more places were like this! I was so pleased he got to try the same finger sandwiches but on gluten free bread. He also had scones and little desserts and said the iced tea was the best he ever had. It is expensive when compared to other high tea places but TOTALLY worth it in my opinion, considering the quality of food and that you can get any of your food trays refilled at any time. We also liked that formal dress including jacket and tie for men were not required. Service was excellent and we definitely left feeling full and satisfied. I highly highly recommend if you want for full high tea experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom. Clotted cream and jam on the best scones
Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom. Gluten free selection was outstanding
Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom. Gluten free (on the left) and regular on the right

Ii5hkJ7QcJBTeOxTkshmUg.text: Beautiful experience. A classic place to get afternoon tea in London. It's absolutely gorgeously decorated inside with excellent service and stunning table ware. The food was good, although honestly the scone could have been better. I was surprised it wasn't excellent, but everything else we had was lovely so four stars from me.

V6YnwbkGXH9IUoub2kPSrQ.text: Overall the experience was very good.  Live piano was a lovely addition to the ambience.  Service was very good and the food was enjoyable.  The tea choices were excellent.  My only complaint is related to the seating.  I made this reservation months ago and would have expected a better table since I had reserved it so long ago.  We did notice that since we are American, there seemed to be an American "section".  All Americans were seated in the same area near the hostess stand and the table closest to the restrooms.  The Locals were seated at the better tables by the windows and the middle of the room.  Very disappointing.

IuKYykW1j_utcwiB4lZleQ.text: Such a tourist move, but how could you go to London and not have afternoon tea?! Having done extensive research, the Diamond Jubliee Tea Salon at Fortnum and Mason stood out to me as they had an extensive tea selection list. We opted to share the savory afternoon tea menu as it was pretty much the same as the sweet, except you get an extra tier of savory elements for 4 pounds extra. The scones are also savory instead. A little frightened and overwhelmed with the selections of tea, we asked our waitress for her recommendations. In the end we went with the Jubliee and the Royal Blend as she claimed those two were the most popular. Unfortunately, my boyfriend had the stomach virus, but didn't want to cancel our reservations / wanted me to still have the tea experience for our last day in London, so he wasn't able to eat much, but he drank plenty of tea. I pretty much ate the entire 3 tiers, which wasn't a problem because everything was absolutely delicious! My favorites were the curry chicken sandwich and the scones with the savory spread. The scones were SOO good - they're tiny, but very dense, but so addicting. If I wasn't stuffed, I would have asked for a refill on the scones, when I asked for a refill on the curry chicken sandwiches. Tip - if you're refilling food, I would just refill all your tiers because they box up your leftovers and allow you to take them home! Oh and if you think you're full and can't handle any more food, you'll totally forget that you had that thought when they offer to show you their table of desserts. I told myself I'll just look and just have a small slice of whatever stood out to me the most. BUT then I got to the table and EVERYTHING looked good, so I asked for a small slice of each (there were 5 cakes, so I had 5 small slices); talk about self control right? My favorite two cakes were the two cakes that were specifically known in London. They were so elaborate and colorful and looked really sweet, but once you have a bite, they're so moist and buttery and not very sweet at all! More of a coffee lover, I wasn't expecting too much from the teas, but the Jubliee and the Royal Blend were so good that we both finished our pots, refilled the Jubliee as we preferred that more AND then ordered a pot of the Earl Grey (which we then loved more than the Jubliee and refilled too)! Seriously, their teas are THAT amazing that after our afternoon tea, we went downstairs and bought an insane amount of tins of tea to bring home for ourselves and friends. OH and my boyfriend and I swear that their tea has healing powers because he instantly felt better and was cured of his sickness after our 2 hours dining here. Afternoon tea, especially at the Diamond Jubliee Tea Salon at Fortnum and Mason is a must!!

photos.caption: Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom. Savory tea selection
Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom. Curry chicken sandwiches

v7wC3YsKLxRz3N4MEaukNw.text: An overly crowded tourist trap with extremely slow service. Need to wait 20 minutes to get waiters attention if you want to order something, then once order it will them another 20 minutes to serve it, even though it's just pre made sandwiches. Also got served food ordered by a different table. Very disappointing experience.

A3dQTq9Wmzv29ukyMRDYiA.text: We did the tea experience and it was lovely! Photo below. You try 4 teas you havent had before and the teaista teaches about them. The Lobster bisque/omelette was AMAZING, and thr gluten free sandwiches were very good (also posted below) The Diamond 75 champagne was so so delicious. All in all, while expensive they certainly feed you.

photos.caption: Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom

O6HLGQSDdwJrQNbt7DQCIg.text: Best Tea experience ever! Sat right next to the man playing the piano while I sipped my tea , sandwiches , and biscuits . Make sure to get biscuits & clotted cream butter .

YK1tDT8WPedrGC4bzPwrGg.text: What a fantastic afternoon tea experience.  From the service to the food to the atmosphere of the salon, there was nothing more I could ask for except more stomach room.We arrived a bit early, and waited on couches in the lobby area before being escorted to our table.  Having done our research beforehand, one of us ordered the afternoon tea and the other the savory tea.  As for the tea, I opted for the Jubilee tea blend (normally I'm not a fan of black but the description was intriguing) and my brother listened to the server's recommendation and ordered a rose-flavored tea.  Needless to say, good decisions all around!  We loved our respective teas, and got two pots of refills each.  As for the food, the sandwiches are deceptively filling, and I was quite stuffed by the time I moved on from the scones to my dessert platter.  It looked almost too pretty to eat, the key word being almost.  I was the biggest fan of the cucumber and chicken salad sandwiches, the majority of the savory plate, and the lemon and chocolate flavored desserts on top of the afternoon tea tier.  The scones were a bit dry, requiring much clotted cream and jam.  I felt like I couldn't eat another mouthful, but my brother tried the black and white cake and said he was a fan.After we ate, we lingered over our pots of tea for a while before deciding we had digested enough and were ready to go.  Throughout our meal, our server was unfailingly friendly and helpful, and there were enough people walking around to attract someone's attention about a refill.  Watching them prepare the tea at the bar in the back was also quite fascinating.Obviously, it was extremely pricey, and you are expected to dress nicely, but what the heck.  You only live to try afternoon tea in London once.

photos.caption: Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom. Jubilee tea
Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom. Sandwiches
Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom. Scones

w5vFOdNxAjsg_3fXPAYSAA.text: This was an absolutely delightful experience.  Everything from the piano playing in the background to the excellent and genuinely warm Customer service.  If you're visiting London, this is a must do. Book early in advance and prepare yourself to enjoy true culinary greatness.

photos.caption: Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom

JmdNSvjwCqlbZPvlWvQKyQ.text: Absolutely incredible experience of afternoon tea. The service is on point - all very helpful and alert. Great choice of tea as they offer a variety of teas you wouldn't normally find. The food selection is great and super delicious - definitely have something for every taste. Piano player in the background is a lovely addition to the experience.

1hPwQQuRk6u9Q2gscqYsuA.text: The service here was spectacular. The atmosphere was elegant and plush. High tea was extremely enjoyable and we felt pampered. If that is all you are looking for, the diamond jubilee is the place to be. The food itself though was very lack luster. I can't really remember what we even had but thought it probably came from a box. (Don't quote me on that). There is a plentiful tea selection and the overall experience was great, but don't have high expectations of a great meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom

3LTbpm4qgSsH1GBm0jtfLw.text: Amazing experience with a proper English tea! We missed our reservation due to problems on the tube & came 20 minutes late, but they still honored it. Service was fabulous and everything was absolutely delicious! Definitely go to Fortnum & Mason for your true English tea time fix!

7F1xFMXMH2_DiFO0wWbNPA.text: We ordered the traditional Afternoon Tea. If I wasn't so disoriented from the flight and 1h+ tube travel (this is the first place we went) I would have thought to order both the traditional and savory trays for my family to try. I found it to be very pricy for the type of food but it is the quintessential British experience. The scones were delicious, the jams were a bit too sweet. The finger sandwiches were tasty enough. The little desserts were very good. I suggest better explanation of the tea varieties and offer recommendations to your guests.

jCFg1bKE_fDdJbyeNIVi7g.text: My husband and I thought we would try high tea at the famous Fortnum and Mason. The shop itself is quite splendid, and the Christmas decorations are so very beautiful that I kept stopping to look at the trees. High tea is nowhere near as good though. The sandwiches were forgettable and the scones were some of the worst I've ever had. Even the jam could not redeem them, and they only had scones with raisins in it, no plain ones available for those of us who don't like raisins. The tea was also just average. I was really not impressed at all by the high tea. You would think such a fancy place would have high quality food, but they don't. I have had high tea at other places that are not as famous, and it was much much better. Even the high tea at Harrods, which was not really amazing, was still miles above this. The high tea at Sketch is much better as well, and the best I've had was in a little French place in Montreal that may not be famous, but is a thousand times better than any of these.I would say skip the high tea, save your money, and get a pretty tin of biscuits from here, which ARE actually high quality and yummy.

qVDp2YqNkbOnt8Uv5ncpqA.text: FANTASTIC afternoon tea!!! Now I can't say I am an afternoon tea expert, but I can claim that I am a tea expert, and boy was their tea good! Not only did it taste amazing, but you got to work your own drainer for the tea dregs which made it quirky and fun! And the scones/desserts, by jove they were amazing! Their scones were flaky, and the desserts tasted as great as they looked. Though it's pretty expensive, it really is worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom. GET CAKE FROM THE CAKE TABLE!!!!

Xmca_xQk2WV6t8WhnkcWjQ.text: Thanks to my English coworker who recommended this beautiful and elegant tea salon in Picadilly, London!!! The 1st floor is the store where they sell teas,jams,sweets, etc. The 2nd floor is the restaurant. The 3rd floor is the tea salon, which was adorned with Tiffany colored drapes, table mats, even the servers' shirts! Although we've experienced tea rooms in LA, we had to try tea in London!! And it was pretty expensive lol. We couldn't share so we both ordered $60/ea the UNLIMITED AYCE tea/finger sandwiches/pastries.The server started us off with 4 tea tastings of our choice. We tried the white tea from China, Darjeeling tea from India, black tea from India, and the lotus tea from China. I chose the Darjeeling and my BF the black. Both were very smooth rich and fragrant. Btw, the tea pot/tea set was quite cute and lovely! We started off with 4 finger sandwiches. Actually I had the yummy sandwiches to myself bc my bf doesn't care for sandwiches at all.Cucumber and mayoSmoked salmon and spicy chipotle sauce Curry chicken Beef carpaccio and mayoTasty!! Next came the smooth soft warm and flaky scones, served with their very own raspberry and marmalade jams. These were the BEST scones/jams we've ever had!!! Then came the pastries OMG! Strawberry eclair with rosé petalsPassion fruit macaronsBrownie bites with gold-chocolate flakesCream puffsHazelnut cakeThese were all to die for!!! I kid you not, we asked for more tea, finger sandwiches, and pastries... and left with some more scones and pastries lol! We are definitely coming back to this tea salon on our next euro trip !! Until next time!!

YQqhAO_9XIa9GxfCco8-Jg.text: Really not worth it. It's better to go to the cheaper tea cafe on the 2nd floor, they have the same tea for 1/4 the price and they don't have the attitude and unprofessional service.

8X5Pbr0z4FPx9QvzBPW5vQ.text: Not having another afternoon tea experience to compare this to, I'm sticking with three stars. This was our first English formal afternoon tea experience. We originally had our sights set on The Ritz, but by the time got around to making plans, they were full. This place was recommended by our hotel concierge. The Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon is on the 4th floor of Fortnum and Mason, which according to my wife is a very famous shop. I had never heard of them, but I don't pay much attention to these things. It was what we expected from English tea, copious amounts of food served on three-tiered trays. The sandwiches were nice, if a bit bland. For me the scones were the best of the food, and the best I ever had. You have the option for endless refills of the trays if you choose. You can also switch out your tea for any of the dozens of selections. Having never done this and not being a big fan of tea, I would have liked someone to give recommendations of teas according to our level of experience. We were not offered this though, and the staff did not provide this even when asked for recommendations.Overall we found it difficult to capture the staff's attention. I understand that it is a struggle to find the balance between letting a couple enjoy their afternoon by giving distance, but there were times we felt on the border of ignored. I had to flag one of them down to ask to change out my tea as we were never offered this. They did bring another plate of sandwiches, but never did bring by the cake trolley even though we said we were interested when they offered. In spite of the failures of the staff, the overall experience was nice. The room is light and airy with bright pastel colors and many windows. We live in the pub-dominated English countryside, so we found this bright room to be very refreshing.  The live piano player also added to the nice atmosphere of the room. Still, I'm not sure we will return for Fortnum and Mason when we come back for more tea in London.The amount of food makes this a reasonable value, but since the more reputable and formal tea rooms are around the same price with similar offerings, I think there are better places to go.

WRz7WlPEXC7RMCx132q-Yg.text: I love afternoon tea, and this is by far the best place I've experienced it at. The setting is beautiful, and I'm glad I dressed up a bit for it. We were seated at a table along the back of the room within view of a nice big window with plenty of natural light. We were brought menus, including tea menus, which are VERY LONG! There was a lot to choose from, so I ended up picking a unique one that is actually grown in England, and it was very nice.There are 3 different afternoon teas to choose from. The 2 afternoon teas come with your typical 3-tier tray with sandwiches on the bottom, scones in the middle, and tiny desserts on top. There are also cakes available after you're finished. (I guess they just can't fit it all on one tray very easily.) High tea differs in that you begin with a hot entrée like an omelet, welsh rabbit, eggs benedict, etc. Then you also get the scones and cakes. There's a variety of different champagne that you can complement your afternoon tea with, ranging in price from a £10 glass to  £150 bottle!Here's a summary of the 3 afternoon tea options: Afternoon tea: finger sandwiches(Cucumber, Coronation Chicken, Ham and Cheese, egg salad, Smoked Salmon), scones with clotted cream and your choice of 2 preserves, Individual cakes and patisseries followed by "a selection from the Coronation Cake Carriage" if you've got room. £40-£44 per person depending on which tea you choose. Savory afternoon tea: same finger sandwiches, savory scones, savory tartlets/blini/Mille Feuilles, etc. Also comes with cakes at the end. £42-£46 per person depending on which tea you choose. High tea. Choice of savory dish, scones with clotted cream and preserves,  individual cakes and patisseries, then cake if you can fit it! £44-£48 per person depending on which tea you choose. We went with the classic afternoon tea, and chose raspberry jam and lemon curd to go with our scones. The scones were amazing: by far the best I've had at anywhere in London or the US: warm, flaky, and not-too-sweet, perfect for slathering clotted cream and lemon curd on. The finger sandwiches were all served on different breads and used top-notch ingredients. I really enjoyed the coronation chicken and the smoked salmon. The desserts on the top were good, but there was a rose éclair which I thought was cloyingly sweet. After we finished with all of that, we asked for a slice of lemon cake, which was delicious but I was very full by that point, so I didn't have much. I'm not sure how people manage the "high tea"!Our afternoon tea tray came out quickly, while the tables around us were doing the high tea and the hot dishes seem to have taken quite some time. I didn't feel like our food had been sitting out at all, though - I have definitely had tea at places before where the tray of food has been sitting out or refrigerated so everything is the same temperature and the scones aren't even warm. That's just sad. I was glad that F&M gave us piping hot scones, that really makes it!The only slightly odd aspect of the experience was when a waiter stopped by to bring our tray of tiny sandwiches, scones and desserts, and told us "If you manage to eat all of that, we'll bring you some cakes as well", as if it were some kind of all-you-can-eat buffet challenge! I will definitely come back for tea here again. I recommend wandering around the many floors of the store after you're done, as well - there's lots to explore.EDIT! After reading a few other reviews, I just want to say: there were definitely no raisins in my scones (YUCK), they were just plain, and awesome. Also, I didn't realize that you could switch out your tea for pretty much any other one you wanted to try! I should have done that.. Next time I think I'm skipping breakfast and dinner :)

photos.caption: Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom. finger sandwiches: cucumber and cream cheese, coronation chicken, roast beef, smoked salmon with lemon dill butter, egg salad
Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom. china
Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom. corner table

gkn5sTJl0OR11p-EfKG_UA.text: I had heard so much about Fortnum and Mason's afternoon high tea, so when i went with my family over the summer, it exceeded my expectations. Honestly, it was like a dream being able to have a high tea in London - we felt like royalty. Don't come with a full belly, because you will certainly leave with one! One of my family members is gluten free, and we were thrilled when making a reservation, that they offered a gluten free option. *I would highly recommend making a reservation because you don't want to wait or risk not getting a table when you see the tea trays being brought out!* I was really pleased with the selection of teas - they had an entire book with over 20 different tea choices! Also, the sandwiches were absolutely delicious, from salmon and cream cheese to roast beef. Another great thing about Fortnum and Mason's high tea was that they had 3 different food options. I got to try them all which were all really scrumptious! Another awesome thing was that there are free refills for everything!The food was presented impeccably, was delicious, and overall the afternoon tea at Fortnum and Mason was certainly one to write home about! Make sure to bring your camera and a ready appetite!

photos.caption: Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom. smoked salmon and herb cream cheese scone

jy-rZwO1CPry5NMhHtPdMw.text: What a lovely High Tea experience today at the Diamond Jubilee Tea Room  We all ordered variations of high tea from sweet to savory. The finger sandwiches were a delighful array of salmon , cucumber chicken and corn , and roast beef . Those that ordered main courses such as the lobster and eggs , or eggs Benedict were equally happyThe second course of scones ., either savory or sweet were delightful and what can beat a good clotted cream .The pastries were light and delicate ranging from tasty macaroons to a rose eclair and other treats. The teas were all wonderful.To top off the experience we can't say enough about the wonderful wait staff.  Attentive when necessary but not intrusive . The maître de miles was amazing . Full of wonderfull advice and knowledge about tea. He went the extra mile. Would recommend this to anyone for a lovely experience!!

D_uuWOt-pVB5haPXZ_CN8g.text: The best high tea I've ever had. Everything was perfect! I love their tea selection and their staff is very knowledgeable. Scones were to die for!

photos.caption: Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom

MoJkjvtSfkGOkIFHeVsZuQ.text: Unfortunately their scones, the centrepiece to every Afternoon Tea were dry and crumbly like day old bread. Not one, but two of them were equally disappointing and stale. Service was a bit flat and I waited over 15min to be seated -with a reservation. Not what is expected from the elegant establishment serving the quintessential English tea.

SeLzD5MRy2-4ILWSyEW78Q.text: We popped in without a reservation.  The lovely woman at the front desk said that she might have a table for us (even thought there were plenty).  She looked us over (we were wearing dresses and hubs looked nice) and then handed us a menu and showed us what was available and pointed out the price.  Yes...we knew that it was going to be expensive but I think she might have looked over our designer bags and shoes and thought we couldn't afford it???  Either way, she sat us immediately and things went up from there.  This is top notch.  Everything was delicious.  Service was attentive without being overbearing.  We were pleasantly full.  They offered to package up the items we didn't eat.  LOVE, love, LOVE F&M tea.

vgO1louHOMlDOIccaUR7Lw.text: We had savory afternoon high tea. Cakes were too sweet and nothing special at all which is over priced (£47 each)I love everything about this building (from underground floor to 3rd floor- please check it out) except its tearoom. Not recommended!

_9SE58szsUrDmVK5wlo_Jw.text: Turquoise color on everything is a bit intense. But overall, this was a good experience (would give it a 3.5 if I could). The scones were moist and warm when they were served. They sandwiches were okay. You can have unlimited orders of both if you wanted. I'd say the highlight was the pastries. Those make you want more - which you can't have without paying for another 35£, unfortunately.What bugged me was that our server tried so hard to get us to have the champagne to kick off the high tea but then he forgot about it after we agreed. =/

T5vUZfO0SfqQUQ9Lt4tj_A.text: Miles, Miles, Miles. What an amazing experience! We had the most wonderful ambassador of such a special place.  He went out of his way to make sure our glasses and plates were full with scrumptious food and even found great recommendations for dinner. I firmly believe that without Miles we would not have had such a marvelous time. My mother and her best friends came to visit me in London and they will be talking about this day for years to come!

Glw5cCOhqfyt7oh7vo8Hkw.text: Refillable sandwiches - yay.Very good tea selection - yay.Lacklustre sweets - boo.Servers who discussed our table while looking over and snickering and then POINTING - BOO.Price - boo.I've been to a few different places in London for tea now, and will continue to do so because I love it so much.  If you're reading this, go to the Wolseley.  Cheaper and much more delicious (and yes, I'm judging by the sweets, but that's the point of tea, non?)

KfiBHYOYxjM2oeFrOReCcw.text: I had a lovely afternoon tea on my birthday. I liked the teas(black tea with peach and wedding breakfast blend). The food was fairly nice, satisfying and is refillable. They played me birthday song and served the cake with a candle which is sweet. We ended up staying there for almost three hours even though they stated in the email just 90mins. It was a pleasant experience in general.

photos.caption: Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom

wzc2FayCZhoyZ-_BUtG-BQ.text: We didn't have reservations, and just went to the tea salon and asked how it worked, this being our first tea. I had no idea that you could 'replenish' your tray! So glad we asked how it worked, then we proceeded to ask if we could get a table.  5 minutes later, we are sitting down waiting for our server... and waiting...and waiting.  Finally, I caught his eye, and he came right over.  If service had been better, this would have been a 5 star. I also wish I could deduct half a star for how warm they keep that room.   Having to call over the waiter to keep replenishing my drinking water (glasses are TINY) is so annoying.  Then again for more hot water for the tea.  He did give us good recommendations for the tea, but how can you go wrong with any tea from Fortnum and Mason? The sandwiches were quite good, as were the sweets (scones and cakes). Still, glad we did this around £50 or so, pricey, but a real treat!

jeh8PBdb2WqqvlIcD5C6eA.text: F&M afternoon tea has been one of my landmark London stops since my mom and I first went there when I was fifteen.  I felt very grownup and fancy then, and I still feel that way when I go there umpteen years later.  The decor is very TEAL, but also very comfortable.  It's just a nice place to spend an afternoon.  While afternoon tea here is pricey, there is so much food!  There are a variety of different offerings, including a savory tea, brunch-type offerings like omelettes, and high tea, which is more like a hearty afternoon meal.  I had the basic afternoon tea, with its tea sandwiches (cucumber and mint, egg salad, coronation chicken, which was a curried chicken salad, and smoked salmon), scones and pastries.  The scones were delicious, and who doesn't like clotted cream?  Probably someone who doesn't like deliciousness, that's who.  The pastries were also really delicious:  there was a rose-flavored eclair that was yummy and different, plus some other, more standard fare (a chocolate praliné thing, a lemon tart, etc.)The service was really attentive, and the server seemed genuinely disappointed that I couldn't take the lemon curd and strawberry preserves with me (it now comes in jars rather than little pots, so apparently you get the jars to take away). And she kept offering me more scones, cakes from the jubilee cake trolley, more tea, more whatever.  Like I said, it was a copious amount of food!  Which I think is important, given the exorbitant cost.  But for a once in a blue moon special day, it is definitely worth it.

dacSKPQh6mp8HXv_Hu-pRQ.text: A beautiful spot for high tea! 5 stars for service and beautiful ambiance (and piano music) alone. The servers were snooty enough so that you felt like you were getting a very pompous and luxurious experience, but friendly enough that you didn't feel uncomfortable. I don't know if that makes sense but it was exactly what I wanted. 6 stars for the scones and lemon curd. I want to drown in that lemon curd and my life has been forever changed by those scones. The sandwiches and sweet plate were perfectly fine but slightly underwhelming. I didn't like a lot of the sweets but surprisingly really liked the orange cake which looked artificial in color but was actually bursting with flavor.

VmLC8pLvaxVR8MhuRVwxXA.text: We had afternoon tea here last year & found the food to be delicious & the service attentive. To say they've slipped would be a colossal understatement. For £199 for 3, I would hope to have beverages in under 15 minutes and actually receive our order in a timely fashion.  Alas, no. Although they claim you can request your tray be refreshed (seconds, if you will) it took more than 20 minutes & even then, only  1/2 of the items ever came. Super disappointing. We won't be back, nor recommend.

MHTVnlnYL07mW8wy1LAuyw.text: Having tea with some friends.  Tea sandwiches, scones, champagne, tea, and chocolate desserts. This place is fun but the scones are a little dry....still worth the trip.

YUsCwKYMjVpcbAF6TGOv0A.text: Service was outstanding! We didn't book a reservation online, but luckily there was an opening that day! It was worth the wait, the decor of the room and the whole ambiance of the floor is so grand and beautiful. You can get you high tea sets refilled as much as you can, I loved the cucumber sandwiches. The dessert cart was amazing as well, get to your sweet tooth! Try both the sweet and savory sets, as you can get your items refilled. The wait staff are very attentive to your table and refill your teapots and foods quickly. There's a good tea selection on the menu. After your meal, pop downstairs to see the street level floor to see all they tea sets and items they sell.

tY8cmrFNOB9k1O8lDS7kww.text: Funny how sometimes reunions with old college friends happen at the most unexpected places. Found out College Friend 1 was going to be in London for work at the same time as me and was meeting up with College Friend 2 who was finishing up her Master's degree in London. I crashed their afternoon tea plans at Fortnum and Mason. Love that their afternoon teas are refreshable (otherwise known as all you care to eat)! You can even pack the remaining items you can't finish to take home, including the jars of jam. Due to our size, we were able to choose from both the savory and sweet afternoon tea menus. It was great, as we balanced the sugary desserts and scones with finger sandwiches and savory small bites. What made our experience, other than the wonderful company from friends, was the pianist, Angus. He played for a couple of hours while we were there and he played beautifully. He played classic piano pieces as well as more modern tracks. We were able to request certain ones (I See the Light from Tangled) and were amazed when we played our favorites at random - Yiruma's River Flows in You for me and Charlie Puth's See You Again for BF. We stayed for 4 hours - mostly to hear Angus play (and yes, he took breaks too, so we sat through two of his playing shifts)!A hefty price tag at £51 per person, but worth every £!

Tsi3NVyoXOU6xhIY8xjngw.text: An English tea experience.We had English tea, sandwiches, and little desserts. It was a lovely experience.I wish I had packed a proper English hat to wear on such an occasion. The service was good and they were helpful in picking out a tea we might like to drink.
