S7KEKJ-AXGUAYH-QggsSzQ.text: The first afternoon tea place I have ever been to. My wife and I went here around 4:00pm but there's already a long line there but since we have reservation, we got seated pretty quick.They have several sets on the menu for us to choose from. We chose the most classic one - Afternoon Tea. It serves with sandwiches at the bottom, scones in the middle and some desserts at the top. All of them tastes delicious. And everything is REFILLABLE!I ordered the Royal blended as the tea and my wife ordered the fruit flavor tea. Both of them tastes great!

5Y-_TGxfhOLI1W_LOD7Azw.text: This was an awesome experience for me and a must do in my list when we went to London.  As I was planning my trip, I wanted to make sure that I am able to experience high tea, and because of the ratings I picked Fortnum and Mason.  We arrived in London in the early afternoon, my husband and I were exhausted from a red eye flight from San Francisco. We had a few hours to rest before our reservations, so we took the tube and made it for our reservations.  This place is elegant, with a store in the main and basement level.  A great place to buy gifts for when you return home, but in our case, this was the first city in our 2 week European trip.We had an awesome server, that explained the different types of tea and different ways to order.  He took us through how to go about eating and assured us that if we like anything in particular that he can replenish our plates for more.It was pricey for my husband, but hey I came here for the food and mostly the experience.  I am not going to London just because, I might as well experience high tea.

Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom. Needed to take a pic of myself drinking tea during high tea with my pinky up!
Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom

IGXfgGOtEzeuzkbXn8_ASQ.text: Just not my cup of tea. Very cute place, however the afternoon tea was mediocre. I opted for the royal tea which was okay only. I had some of Queen Anne which I enjoyed more. Their black teas are best with milk & sugar. Out of all the pastries, cute dried ass scones, tea sandwiches, I enjoyed the hazelnut chocolate square the most and their rich chocolate cake. Their tea sandwiches were nothing to rave about, very disappointed with the salmon and surprisingly, I enjoyed the curry chicken one. However, I'm not really a curry fan, except for Steph Curry of course so I didn't finish it. Overall, you're paying for some ambiance and service was not bad until it was busy.

ypxy-IE9pKN9dyzjq_p68w.text: So AMAZING!!! I love this place and would be going back everyday if I lived in London and had money to spare! It's so cute and feminine inside with light blue cups and napkins. Love the cute trays the pastries/desserts come out on. Our server was super nice and the english accent doesn't hurt either! ;) The whole experience can take a couple hours or more but it's worth it in my experience. Besides the tea room, the store itself is great and I felt like a kid in a candy store except it was mostly the teas and biscuits/cookies I was excited about. There is candy in the store as well for all you candy lovers out there but I was just more focused on other things. I wish a Fortnum & Mason's would open in Minneapolis. On second thought..maybe not.. I'd be there everyday spending money! Honestly, if you're in London this is one place you do not want to miss out on.

fkPyisuPJpd803Wa1XvUXg.text: i came here with one of my GF's and her husband.  This place doesn't disappoint. They have an extensive tea list and sandwich selection and the atmosphere is more casual than other places.  Good deal and it's inexpensive.What I disliked most, lack of staff, which seems to be everyone's complaint. Being understaffed leads to crappy service at times...overall, it is still a value compared to other tea rooms

photos.caption: Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom

p8Gynr4MHshpHwErdSVODg.text: 5 stars for the tea. 5 stars for the tea tasting with the sommelier. 4 stars for the environment. Very nice and elegant but not as Grand as some high tea services in hotels for example. 4 stars for the service. Friendly but slow. 2 stars for the food. You can get all you can eat but I didn't want to eat much of it. The food was a heavy handed assault on the palate. The sweets were way too sweet. The savory was way too salty and the rich to heavy. We ordered the savory and standard tea service. The only thing on both menus I thought was good was the plain scone with lemon curd. And I have had better scones at cafes. How sad is that. It's worth going for the experience of getting tea and the tea itself is really good but the food is forgettable.

photos.caption: Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom. Tea menus

B52Y0TDKlZTcj2j1ySb-_Q.text: Had a fabulous time there with my girls for my youngest daughters birthday...they really took care off.  Kudos to the staff for being a very high class place.

_75fJYP3S6ZclK2zqweMYQ.text: When in London, you must have afternoon tea! This was the highlight of my last trip to London. I'm so happy that we chose to come to Fortnum & Mason. This whole building is gorgeous! There are multiple floors with clothing, accessories, tea and sweets but we went straight up to the Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon! We walked in without a reservation on a Sunday during peak afternoon tea hours and they were able to get us a table. Myself and 3 of my girlfriends had the cutest, fanciest tea ever. Our server was so adorable! He was very sweet, proper and super attentive. Everyone we spoke to was very kind and extremely helpful. I chose a Famous Blend and went with "Wedding Breakfast" - it was delightful. My favorite mini sandwiches were the chicken and the egg salad. The sun dried tomato scone was really good as well. You can revisit any items as much as you like with the sweets and savories in the classic afternoon tea and even take things to go. If you're hungry don't be afraid you will be satisfied! The desserts, ohhh they were fantastic! Random: The bathrooms are so cute and the hand lotion in there was so amazing. I need to track it down for my own home.Overall, it was a marvelous experience, it was honestly perfect- better than I expected. I highly recommend afternoon tea at F&M when you're in London, it is a must! The experience is unforgettable.

photos.caption: Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom

8xKx7KLgQDRt5bkTgBmOMQ.text: Thoroughly enjoyed my visit here for high tea (my first ever!) The ambiance felt appropriately aristocratic: well-dressed staff, live piano playing in the background, and fine china and silverware. As you would expect, they have an extensive tea menu, with rare and conventional teas, including black, oolong, yellow, green, and white teas. I had two different black teas (you can select up to 2 teas during your visit). Both were excellent. The food was great as well. Had sandwich bites and an assortment of other finger foods, both savory and sweet. You can also revisit items as many times as you wish. Our waiter was fantastic, patient and provided good recommendations. Tip: if you can, get here at around noon when it's not crowded. At around 1 pm, it gets very hectic. Before arriving at the salon(which is on the 4th floor), take some time to browse the opulent shops on the floors below.

Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom

1UbU29H2TA0yefLB4vyh4w.text: Short and sweet: the service was appalling, the sandwiches bland and stale, the rest was mediocre, the tea itself was nice... when it was finally re-filled. For these prices i expected something at least slightly better than average, but this was nothing short of a waste of good money. Then they had the nerve to charge an £11 service fee, for what?! Our waiter ignored us the entire damn time!Long version: My wife and i were excited to top off a big day out in London with a spot of high tea and spoil ourselves after what was one of the best days of our trip thus far.We arrived ten minutes early for a 6:15 reservation, just to be sure, and were told that they were just waiting for tables to become available (fair enough). We were seated at around 6:40, but didnt mind the wait too much; although a smile, rather than a large sigh, from the front desk would've been a bit more welcoming.We waited a little longer after having gone through the menu ourselves when our first waiter turned up, apologised for the wait and gave us his full attention. He was kind and couteous, he directed us through the menu, took our order and poured some water to drink.The setting was formal but unpretentious, which i liked, what bothered me a little was that some of the other wait staff looked thoroughly miserable, if not downright pissed off as they were carting plates and beverages about, particularly this one guy that i nicknamed 'Lurch'.Our individual teas arrived shortly thereafter, they were fantastic! Our waiter re-filled our now empty tea pots and informed us that his shift was ending and his counterpart 'Marco' would take good care of us... it was all downhill from there.We didn't see Marco for the next 45 minutes. Our food arrived after a while, served by another waitress, my wife had the vegetarian, i had the savory. We ate our sandwiches, which were not much better than a service station packet sandwich, almost stale and kind of soggy at the same time (i suspect they were made much earlier in the day and were nothing special in the flavour dept). The scones were ok, not £50 pp scones, but ok scones, at least the treats on the top teir were quite nice...Our glasses were empty by the time the meal arrived, our teapots bone dry before our first scone and plates completely finished after about 20 minutes and still no sign of Marco.If i'm paying £50 for a few sweets, a couple of scones and a handfull of sandwich slivers i don't think that a full glass of water and a replenished pot of tea is too much to ask, nor should i have to try and flag down this MIA waiter, which we attempted several times, only to have him wander across the other side of the room serving others at a snails pace and ignoring us.After finally acknowledging us whilst serving a new table next to us, we politely asked for a few more savory items and a fresh pot of tea, which came... after a long time and at snails pace. I was certain that i must have somehow offended this man, despite being nothing short of patient and trying to be understanding, but why else would he avoid us like the plague? Or did he simply forget we were there?Upon finishing our tea pots again and nibbling on a few more savouries we were more than ready for our slice of cake to go and the bill... que the sound of crickets again. By the time he got around to cutting our slices, they had run out of the one i wanted.In the end we were at the saloon for about two and a half hours, which was not our intention. Half an hour of this was waiting for our reserved table, 30 minutes were spent actually eating/drinking and the remaining hour and 15 mins was either waiting for food or waiting to be noticed.By the time we got the bill i was sick and tired of the entire experience and just wanted to leave asap... then i saw the additional £11 service fee that was slapped on top of our £100 bill for two mediocre snack platters with a few luke warm cups of (admittedly tasty) tea. I felt my eyeball twitching, something inside me snap and did what any discerning tourist with social anxiety would do in that moment... i bit my lip hard, paid the bill, left without talking to anyone, vowed to never return and started drafting this review in my head.I've eaten at a few nice and $$$$ places in my time and even if the food isnt quite as nice as expected, the service usually makes up for it. This establishment wasted two hours of my life, provided average food, pathetic service, terrible value for money and ruined what was a good day.

QxtQpdS-7kHqXpwLYYlP3Q.text: Able to get a reservation at The Ritz for afternoon tea. However, when I was told coat and tie required, I don't wear coat and tie on vacation. I then was able to get a reservation for 4 of us at F&M for afternoon tea. I had the Peach Black Tea which was excellent (drank 3 pots). Staff was attentive even though they were pretty busy on a Sunday afternoon tea time.They even have a gluten free menu for the wife.Scones were outstanding and the 5 different finger sandwiches were excellent. My son and I ordered seconds as refills comes with the set menu.We were so full that they packed the dessert cake for us take away.I have had afternoon tea at many of the former British colonies and F&M afternoon tea ranks right near the top.After enjoying the tea for about 2 hours, we went downstairs and did some shopping of F&M items before heading home.

lKfuLDCHN40rhR5L1sb9EQ.text: Was able to get a last minute reservation through Open Table.  Although pricey and prissy, the food was good and free refills on the pastries, sandwiches, and tea were available.  Would come here again, but with having afternoon tea between lunch and dinner, I felt like I was overstuffed with food like after eating Thanksgiving dinner in the US.

fp9NOa7ICyU44bf-L4D3-A.text: No difference from the parlor or gallery, though they say there is a difference in the food. Maybe desserts...main difference is the price. About 57 quid pp for tea, while downstairs is 24 quid pp. Gimme a break. Downstairs is better too, More life. This room is for dying, it's hell with old ladies....Pretentious....I'll take glamour at the Ritz Palm Court over this !!

ROA3jXeG0mjfUoabU5aoLw.text: I loved every second of it! I got the Countess Gray tea and I loved it so much I went and bought it downstairs. The desserts were amazing and they were very accommodating to my pineapple allergy. The scones were out of this world good and the cream and jam took it to another level. I loved all of the sandwiches especially the coronation chicken. The best part is that you can get more of anything you want. I had a slice of battenberg cake that was sort of dry but the rest of the experience was great!

mX822Rh7IHqfFUUr9kRODg.text: Best Scottish egg that I ever had, thick and moist putter sausage layer, soft and running egg yolk. Very nice tea selections, scones are warm and crisp on the outside with their famous jam is excellent. Overall very good afternoon tea restaurant.

ReAHMoGBo3FdfZJ34lM8Jw.text: Fortnum & Mason is such a treat and an institutional staple to London. There are different offerings on each floor with the first floor for awesome souvenirs of teas, chocolates, cookies, jams etc. I got  musical tins of chocolate cookies and they were a total hit. After the cookies were done, they act as great décor and mini storage of knick knacks. Forgot which floor, but I think its the third floor that has the women's apparel that also sell vintage bags including a lovely Chanel that were extremely overpriced. The ambience and décor of the 4th floor tea parlor is unbeatable. As you walk off the elevator, you are greeted by a polite hostess and a guy on the grand piano playing live music. Definitely make reservation! The interior is so spacious and grand with the loveliest moldings. The service is extremely polite but can be slow based on the server. The sweet pastry tea set was so much better than the savory set. The savory set offered during time of my visit was not my cup of tea. I didn't like it so my friend asked for seconds for some of the item in her set for me. Even though the set is more than enough to fill you up, you can always ask for seconds for any item in your set. We both took the slice of cake from the cake cart to go.

zVXu8fXBej6WpHJApxmJXw.text: This is the most amazing place! Afternoon tea is so delicious! Wonderful delicious choice of sandwiches scones and deserts so amazing!! The tea is out of this world so lovely!! The service is tip top! Very attentive waiters so helpful! I would recommend this beautiful tea room to everyone!! Can't wait to go back for afternoon tea again!!

dwOalA4c7xP1TLCK9CvBzQ.text: Overrated for the price and experience . Food was cute and good but it's just small sandwiches and desserts- I don't think the bar is very high to make these decent. What really bothered me is the service. It was terrible. Not very friendly. I was just sitting around wondering when they come by. Even initially after they sat me, I just sat there totally confused if they had even seen me. It would have been more than 15 mins if I didn't haul someone (which was difficult to do) - and this is just to get a menu! Honestly it just seemed like they get a lot of tourists so they want to churn out the number of seats. Very rudimentary. Sadly the decor did not make up for it. I think you can find cheaper options and just as good food at a more local cafe.

J_IM0zY9RHkhptMb5unudQ.text: We are visiting from the US and this was a big deal for us to get afternoon tea. Although the prices are expensive, we were looking forward to the experience.  We had a reservation at 1700, arrived at 1645 and were promptly seated. No one came to wait on us until 25 min later when we let a woman clearing tables that no one had taken our order. We continued to have terrible service, having to flag down the woman clearing tables again (as it seemed our waitress was ignoring us) to get more tea and get up and go to a wait stand to ask for our check.  After spending $180, we left still hungry, frustrated and very disappointed as this was an experience we had much anticipated which ended up being a huge (and extremely costly) let down.

HH7P9UDcZX3vQK-xOPDZJg.text: We had messaged and chatted with a polite lady online to check if there was a dress code (as we didn't have much time in between flights) and we were assured that there wasn't a dress code as "We want customers to feel comfortable" on Fortnum & Mason's website. Upon arrival on the 4th floor of the tea salon/room, the ladies at the front desk did not so much even glance at us. So, we took it to in our own hands and reviewed the menu available at the desk where they literally stood ourselves. After looking at the one of the ladies, there was still no glance in our direction, so I asked for tea for 2. "Is that the full afternoon tea?" she asked."Yes, please. This one..." I said as I pointed to the menu."That is 49 pounds." "Okay" "Per person - and it would be a 20 minute wait." We decided the service was extremely 'off'. We decided to eat better food elsewhere for less of a price and better where there would be less patronizing service.The food hall downstairs was the same. Selective service. Just because when travelling, we're not dressed formally, it doesn't mean we do not have cash to spend. Zero stars if possible but then the one saving grace was the doorman who was polite, smiled, made eye contact and interacted with everyone. Besides him and the online chat rep on Fortnum & Mason's website, they truly made us feel comfortable and exemplified REAL customer service.The point is, we checked it out especially as this is Her Majesty's choice so we know the price will be more expensive and that is fine. Do the ladies clarify the price, then add 'per person' with no smile, to everyone else? Very discriminating.

QyWWJj5snLZ68lz7KrTq-w.text: This review is gonna be lengthy, so I completely understand if you skip it...Before Fortnum, I went to the Orangery, which was nice and seemed quite traditional.  Great views of the park.  Fortnum, however, was wondrous.  I cannot express how much I love this place and someday, I hope to make my way back.I made a reservation a few weeks in advance and I really didn't know what to expect, but:1.  The pricing is a fair bit more than the Orangery.2.  It's well worth it if you want to have afternoon tea.Fortnum and Mason is apparently split up into different areas, including the Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon for afternoon tea ('high tea' and 'afternoon tea' are the same thing), a large shopping area on the 1st floor, and a dessert/ice cream parlour as well as some other sections that I'm cannot for the life of me remember.Afternoon tea review:  They have several set menu options to choose from, including sweet or savory (the cost of the savory tea selection is a more) and vegetarian or regular, which was nice.  The food is refillable (yeah, that's right!) on all of them, so you can choose to have more of the items that you enjoyed.  It's a standard 3 tier tray, with sandwiches on the bottom, scones in the middle, and small desserts at the top.  There is also a dessert (cakes and pies and stuff) table hanging out for people to cut their own slices and take back to their tables.  This is included with the meal.  Everything on the dessert table was vegetarian.The vegetarian set was very good.  They had a cheese and tomato of which I opted to get more, I think a curry one, and... I don't remember the other 2.  All were pretty good.  It came with two little jars of berry jam for the scones (new and unopened), which I didn't finish but promptly took home.Teas:  Oh my holy great goodness.  The selection is overwhelming, but the Countess Grey was lovely.  Their black teas are probably the way to go, since there's a vast selection of them as opposed to the green.  They give you fresh tea leaves every time they refill your pot, so it's never watered down.  I bought the fruit tea set afterwards, and those were quite good also.  Service:  outstanding.  They refilled our teas, checked on us for refills of food, answered the million questions I asked about their teas (I'm poorly versed in English tea talk), and if the desserts and jams and things had gelatin or were they vegetarian.  I overheard/saw a man at the next table staring at one of my sandwiches and then asking a server about it (the man had opted for the regular savory tea set) and asking if he could try one of my sandwiches.  It was the cheese and tomato one- and the server brought him a few to try.  It wasn't even part of his set and they were nice enough to bring him a few.The experience itself is phenomenal, so go prepared to sit, hang out, and lounge about to live from the piano.  Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom. Refill of the sandwiches I liked- from the vegetarian set.
Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom. Serious jam. No joke.
Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom. They change out the types of jam every once in a while. Feel free to take the cute little jar.

-SlAY6AEFnTEhyWf_7-vpg.text: I really enjoyed their finger sandwiches, scones, desserts.  I had the black peach and strawberry tea which was quite good with and without milk / sugar.  I would come back again.  A must for people who really love tea!  It is close the Picadilly Circle, Green Park, Wolsely, and Buckingham Palace.

NJuqhq8NNGL2VeMHMnfAow.text: The epitome of my dream London experience: afternoon tea. So when my aunt told me that she had booked us for tea during our whirlwind tour of London, I was beyond excited. And it did not disappoint one bit. We got one high tea and one savory afternoon tea--which our awesome and funny waiter suggested as we'd get to try both the sweet and savory scones and pastries. He was also quite helpful when I went to pick out what type of tea I wanted from the overwhelming tea menu. We also got to taste two different champagnes before deciding on a bottle. So after all those decisions were made, we waited for the food to appear while listening to the live piano (and the multiple renditions of "Happy Birthday").The food was excellent and the tea was phenomenal. We ate and ate til we couldn't eat any more. And then we found out that there was a cake cart, and our waiter was kind enough to box up our choices because we were just so full.I know I'll remember this experience forever, as it was the highlight of my trip to London. Hopefully, I'll get to go back someday!!

photos.caption: Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom. Our waiter wanted his glamour shot when he saw my camera
Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom. Something delicious, though I have no idea what it's called
Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom. Finger sandwiches

Ml39SijwoW5l4nRs9g-vbw.text: When I'm in London I always try to go for an afternoon tea so I've been to quite a few. I have to say that Fortnum and Mason have perfected the experience. The service was simply so amazing and our server was the most attentive server I've ever had. She didn't rush us at all and was always making sure we didn't need anymore sandwiches or teas. If you can, try their lemon curd tea - really really good!

uY7ta8WGWeIVxaaNyxGl7Q.text: Whoever knew cucumber sandwiches could be so delicious?!Afternoon tea was great here. Although rather pricey, food was full of flavor and servers were extremely friendly.  I ended up ordering the savory afternoon tea, which as a fair warning, is not "light;" they had savories like pork pie, truffle custard and rabbit rillette, which one piece of each will stuff you full.We were pleasantly surprised at the service, they were very accommodating. Some of the girls in the group had some dietary restrictions but the staff made it very easy to substitute the food. I highly suggest making reservations towards the end of afternoon tea time, they'll let you stay longer (we were told they limit your time to an hour and half or something). We found ourselves staying for a good 2 1/2 hours!

G6VWTYXJX8V2rQruL7rkSg.text: Incredible shop. With unlimited budget you could spend hours here. Dropped 100 gbp on teas and  biscuits. Budget didn't allow for more spending on the amazing collection of sweets and jams and preserves. The earl grey classic is amazing. Biscuits are totally worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom. Haul from F&M

ZrgQkIK0ZycyYDLVLSkb7A.text: Lovely afternoon British adventure. 4.75 stars Food: 4.5, Atmosphere: 5, Service: 3.5Cost to worth it rating: 4 (less expensive than other fancy tea rooms)Return worthiness: yesHighlights:- Atmosphere: piano playing upon entry, lovely large tea room with light blue walls. I was expecting a grandma's bedroom and was pleasantly surprised. - Platewear: Tiffany-like plates were delightful - Options: savory or savory and sweet with sandwiches or mini entrees like beef Wellington and scotch egg. Loved this since I'm not a tea sandwich fan. Also champagne was an option to add which is fun.- Beef Wellington: slice of meat in pastry and the dark sauce on the plate was fantastic. 5 stars - Scones: the way they should be. Dense but with enough air not to be dry. 4 stars- Tea tasting: for extra an expert can choose 4 teas and take you through them. We learned how Chinese and Japanese have different techniques to make green tea and there is such a thing as yellow tea. - Full cakes: slices you chose at the end. Flourless chocolate cake was very rich and strawberry white cake was light.Midlights: - Little cakes: just ok. I liked the mocha chocolate one and the pineappley custard ones but not the othersLowlights:- Spotty service: never saw waitress after we ordered and add she forgot the champagne so we had to remind her after a half hour.Many options for tea in the city and I was delighted with this one and would return.

F3LAkioWrEyJ25SqiyOa_g.text: The place for afternoon tea. Therefore busy. Good thing afternoon tea sitting times go to 7pm. Make sure you get reservation for seating time.Beautiful table settings and China. I love the pastel baby blue and pinks.Sweet and savory sets are around 44£ to 46£, both has same finger sandwiches bottom tray, my husband prefer the savory...each tray can be refilled at NO EXTRA COST. So it's a feast.Don't forget to top halved scones with heavy cream and jam, my husband said the best thing he ate in London.(Written by husband)

T0-jyLyNM7ZZbrSi6LYsQA.text: A beautiful, classic tearoom. Great value for money, it may seem on the costly side, but, with unlimited cakes, scones, and sandwiches as part of your afternoon tea, it really is great. Highly recommend to book early and don't not book at the 6PM slot as you'll be rushed!

9_FriLQGme98jNKeN_XEMw.text: Fantastic Tea experience that may be a bit pricey but well worth it.  Beautiful table setting amazing selection of specialty teas from the expert of teas.  They provide 3 type of experiences,  we chose the standard and savory.  The savory expose my children to a variety of items that they had never experience and expanded their pallet. If you want to do tea right you do it at Fortnum and Mason.

wqFIVIGtTeFKDGyiMV689g.text: This tea was the epitome of everything I expected from an English tea service. The service was fabulous, the room was so clean and elegant. The tea was so good, and all of the teas had some sort of royal background. I truly felt special. The sandwiches were very tasty. We had all three types of tea service so that we could try everything. The scones were my favorite part. I could literally eat the clotted cream by itself. The only thing that was really disappointing were the desserts. I am all about super fancy desserts and fine dining but these seemed more along the lines of pretentious. The flavor wasn't there. Yes they were pretty but they tasted awful. Other than that it was a very nice afternoon tea.

l3r_9o_yb-1j_aO6DoDXJQ.text: Loved loved loved my experience at F&M! My server was both kind, pleasant to talk to, and knowledgeable. There are a lot of places that do afternoon tea, but what makes F&M really stand out for me was:1. You can refill on sweets and savories in the classic afternoon tea. So if you're feeling particularly hungry, this place will fill you up! 2. They offer a tea tasting for £15 (and I think that's for the table as well). You get to pick 4 teas to try and their tea expert comes over to talk about them. I loved being able to try a bunch because I was dining alone. This also really helped me narrow down which teas to purchase afterwards.3. They have 3 story store selling not just teas, but jams, champagne, picnic/gift baskets, household goods, perfumes, etc. Since I got to my reservation early, I scoped out their selection to get an idea of what I would be offered later. I didn't want to commit to anything until I tried them.Walked away with the smoky earl grey, royal blend, queen Anne, and green tea with elderflower. Also bought a set with their lemon curd and strawberry jam because they're also incredibly delicious!

MVzbH5qtTuULC_7fCwo4Sg.text: Opened in 2012 to celebrate the Queen's 60th year reign.  Located on the fourth floor of Fortnum Mason, offers a perfect 1700's historic ambiance. Reservations are highly suggested, and my hotel concierge said I was lucky to find a spot the day before.  I was the first one to be seated as they had just opened. It was pretty cool to be the only one sitting in this grand elegant tea room decorated in the colors of F&M.  The décor was explained to me as "Georgian drawing room".  My hotel concierge recommended that I dress "appropriately" for this special tea.  The place setting and china was all exquisite. The staff were friendly, and the service was perfect.  This is now one of the best tea experiences I have had in my life.  They have different options in their menu to choose from ranging in prices.  It is made to share, but if you are solo like me, they pack whatever you cannot eat and you can take it away with you.  I tried the High Tea option with Lobster Omelet Victoria with Lobster Bisque & Truffle. There are not many dishes I remember the taste of. But I vividly remember the taste and texture of this amazing dish.  The lobster was cooked to perfection. Each bite melted in your mouth.  I get hungry just thinking about it! It also came with their fresh baked plan & fruit scones.  The scones with the clotted cream and F&M's strawberry preserve and lemon curd were decadent.  I think I would have preferred another round of those over the Afternoon Tea Cakes, which was a selection of individual patisseries.  I didn't even make it to the special choice from their cake carriage, and I only took a single bite from each tiny patisserie as it was an overload of sweetness.  If you want to make your time even more luxurious add a glass of champagne for only 12.50 pounds.  Might as well.  It was divine.  We haven't even mentioned the tea. F&M tea is one of my favorite tea brands. There are numerous flavors to choose from. It's overwhelming all the options, and they are all fantastic.  I always love to stock up when in London and bring several of their tea tins home with me. For a classic London tea experience that is worth every penny. This is it!

3TKu3tV7OFK_I_HjkVaYtQ.text: I love the Diamond Jubilee Tea Saloon. Its expensive compared to other Afternoon Tea options in the city, but you pay for the ambiance and the service and unlimited refills on everything.This is the place that I recommend to visiting friends and it fits their vision of a very British Afternoon Tea.While this falls in a higher price bracket, they are also not very fussy about how you are dressed. Smart jeans and a blouse are quite acceptable here, unlike some other tea rooms in this price bracket.If you don't want to splurge on the whole afternoon tea, there is the cream tea option. Personally I prefer the savoury tea menu. There are enough sweet options on this menu, but it has a nice balance of savoury items too.

5Saw8VcVWzH1sJYsvUijmw.text: High Tea at Fortnum & Mason was he highlight of our trip to London. The entire building is gorgeous. Different shops on each level. The top level is reserved for tea. The prix fox afternoon tea is on the more expensive side of what you find in London, but worth every penny. The food is wonderful. Lobster omelette is out of this world. The little sandwiches are great. The tower of food you get is unlimited. The service is impeccable. There is no dress code, but do yourself a favor and toss on a jacket. Have some respect for yourself, you slob.

jBNbjmGcO6843PVUW1IB-Q.text: I was visiting London for the first time, and all my friend had told me I had to do afternoon tea! I wasn't really sure where would be a good spot to go for a one time deal. Didn't want to spend a ridiculous amount but also was willing to spend more than I normally would to have a good experience. My friend told me about Fortnum & Mason, so we decided on this spot. WOw! It is beautiful from the outside. Walking in, I was amazed. Multiple stories selling not only tea but other goods as well.. We had a reservation and there were many open tables when we got there but I believe it is probably almost all from reservations only. The service we received was ok, but we did have to wait a while after we were seated for anyone to come by to answer any questions or get our tea started! We got two of the savory option but I wonder if getting one sweet one savory would've been a better idea to try more? The finger sandwiches were pretty good! Everything including the scones was pretty good, but I don't really remember thinking anything was out of this world. I got the fortmason tea, which was amazing!!! I loved it so much I ended up buy two boxes of it afterwards. It was a good experience because I love tea and had good company in a cute place, but just not sure if it was worth how much we spent for this experience. In USD it came out to about $80 per person.

photos.caption: Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom. Savory option

2r5yfSzROtuKlqA7fcj04Q.text: So, one of the ultimate desires for my wife, was to experience High noon tea, during our stay in London. She researched various reviews, and Fortnum came in at the top five. It's conveniently located pretty close to the tube and one of our favorite places, Carnaby. So we went to the fourth floor, was greeted and seated, and given explanation of the various styles of experiences, as well as, several teas to select from. Anywhere from the Royal to something more current like a chai tea. They even offer some rare teas, which was a little more spendy, but not bad. Of course, the typical Earls and breakfast teas. I myself, selected the Afternoon Tea, and the Royal as my choice of tea. Other than the presentation, which was very elegant, the tea tasted like any other tea. Nothing special that I could detect, at least. What was cool about it was the history of the tea, which they all come with some type of informational about the tea.The assortment of finger sandwiches was awesome! My favorite was the salmon and believe it or not, the cucumber sandwich. The biscuits were pretty decent, but the pastries and little desserts were incredibly succulent! The place definitely has an upscale vibe to it. If you're wearing a hat, take it off  After our tea and snacks, we enjoyed three levels (1-3) of Fortnum's shopping delicacies, teas, and assortments. Checked this off the bucket list, and now we can say we enjoyed afternoon tea. As always, enjoy and Happy Sipping with the Pinky Out!

yytrzWDQT9ZYjjCTOqNu-Q.text: Fortnum and Mason's Diamon Jubilee Tea Salon is a conveniently located place for traditional afternoon tea in London.Located on the top floor of Fortnum and Mason's luxurious Piccadilly digs, the tea salon greets you with courteous staff and the tinkling of live and well-played piano.We were seated promptly and were given a good amount of time to strategize. There are several set menus around the 50 pound mark, including savory and sweet options. I went for the savory with the basic tea, and my boyfriend did the surf and turf with premium tea. Do note that dietary restrictions are easily accommodated, at least on the vegetarian and nut allergy side.The pacing is relaxed, which is perfect so that you don't fill up too much. The tea sandwiches were all exemplary. The surf and turf was tiny but good quality.The savory pastries were a real treat; elevated, somewhat surreal dishes like a smoked salmon macaron and a truffle cream puff. The sweet stuff was all good too. The scones are classic and worth the stomach space. We had to turn down the cake cart by the end since we were so full, and were offered some to go. We also got to take home strawberry preserves and lemon curd as we had barely made a dent in them.All of the tea was great, though note that you'll only likely get to try two per person in terms of the timing. My picks, the Jubilee and a chocolate violet tea, were both lovely. I think the basic selection has enough variety and high enough quality that upgrading isn't necessary.Bookings are essential, but are easy to come by. Service was great; our waiter did a good job reinforcing the manners and order of the tea service without being condescending. It's recommended to dress well, though we saw lots of people breaking that. I personally welcomed the chance to dress up a little in a sundress.Bathrooms are clean. Save some time to browse the rest of the floors after.If you're looking for a traditional British tea, this will satisfy the tourist urges in a classy way.

1VODjYyO0wvYtNEtMSevkg.text: I came here for the ambiance; fancy, deinty feeling - European style. I chose an afternoon tea selections. Service was not warm/ personable. Greeter / receptionist was likeable. Sweet cream n strawberry jam was amazing! Wonderful gifts to bring back to family

cJDkDvhw9B0s8FlIhWHWvw.text: A beautiful tea room and a live pianist. How could anyone ask for more?They basically have two choices for afternoon tea: the regular, which is mostly sweet and the savory. There is also a vegetarian option, which looked pretty darn delicious at the next table over.We ordered both to share. The savory and sweet come with the same sandwiches: Coronation Chicken is a curried salad and is my favorite, the Egg Salad uses a rare breed of hen with a very creamy egg, the Cucumber has a great spread of cream cheese with mint, Ham is ham, and the Smoked Salmon is meaty and less fishy and balances nicely with tomato.The savory scones: Mmmm Bacon! The Tomato one is like a high-end Ritz cracker with a crispy, cheesy layer on top. Both come with complementary spreads, heavy hybrids of butter and cream cheese.I like the sweet scones a lot better. (personal preference - both are equally good). The berry scone is nice, and the plain is perfect, especially with that thick clotted cream and the best lemon curd and strawberry jam I've ever had.The savory top tier is 3 meals in itself. Everything is heavy and rich. There's a pinwheel of smoked salmon in a macaron. The Crab Salad is heavy on the mayo, and if that's not enough, the Foie Gras will finish you off. The Green Cashew Cheesecake is surprisingly light, but the Wild Mushroom Puff with Truffle is not and it is amazing.The top tier of sweets are great, but we couldn't even get through them! Everything is so buttery and rich, that carb coma just sneaks up unexpectedly. Fortunately, they still taste great later in the day. There is a moist and buttery pound cake, an airy strawberry mousse, a well-balanced cheesecake, a passion cake with passion, and a creamy something with a rose petal on top. On top of ALL of that, you get a slice of carriage cake too. The Victoria Sponge is fluffy and just the right hint of sweetness, and the Battenberg Cake too pretty to resist.My only regret is not getting to try more teas. I should have ordered an Earl Grey but I started light with the Silver Needle Pekoe and then the Yellow Buds, thinking I would have room for more. Plus the afternoon tea is AYCE, and I wish I could have found more room somewhere, especially for those scones. Guess I'll have to come back for more!

0c-M12tIimSFe0JfEl30Jw.text: This is a must try for the experience for sure!  You must have a reservation for a table, you cannot show up without one.They are very nice, the waiters/waitresses are very accommodating! It's lovely, the decorations and the sophistication of everything including the decor, the tea sets etc is truly beautiful and relaxing.We got he sweet and savory tea options. I preferred the savory it was much more delicious than the sweetZ to be honest I didn't like any of the sweet pastries offered they tasted pre-made.The savory afternoon tea was honesty TO DIE FOR!! The eclair with mushroom truffle cream was one of the best things I've eaten in years! The Great thing is you can get unlimited sandwiches/scones, pastries etc. we got extra eclairs and I regret not getting more, that's how divine it was!! It's worth it for the experience but he sweet I would give it 3* but the experience bumps it to 4* and the savory tea! You can change tea selections as much as you want but they fill the pot each time so choose wisely! At the end there is a cake section but there was only 3 when we went we asked them to pack it to go and honestly it wasn't that good. Nice to try but they were all dry. So all in all it was a fabulous experience!! I would do it again!

_YqndXVnLcvLnDlJY4TH7A.text: The afternoon tea was an absolute delight and gave us an authentic British experience we will never forget. The wait staff was very attentive and friendly, and the teas and food were delightful. What made the experience even better was visiting the various shops, including the market of high end traditional English fare. One of my favorite items on the menu were the scotch eggs. In fact, they were invented there in the 1700s! I highly recommend this establishment to anyone!

tWd-ysFOpQY5rnNt-ZnJqA.text: One of the best London experiences. Yes, super touristy, but I have no shame. COME HUNGRY!!!I chose this place because they had a vegetarian menu. They also have an option for savory scones which comes with different spreads instead of the OG lemon curd, strawberry jam, and clotted cream.Service was friendly enough, not outstanding though, guy seemed a bit rushed. The sandwiches were good - I got 2 plates. That was a mistake because the scones were even better and I wish I had more room. Seriously, eat the scones first. Dessert was really pretty but didn't taste as amazing as it looked. The cakes were better than the dessert tray. Highly recommend the coconut one. Tea - tons of options. I went with the classic darjeeling but I tried a fruity one that was fantastic. Also, make reservations on opentable in advance. They were super booked.Be sure to check out the shops on the lower level, and the bathrooms holy cow.

KFIOihKHGHF9pzgcZWlIVw.text: A lovely high tea experience that is traditional and luxurious without being pretentious. The Tea Salon is located on the 4th floor of Fortnum & Mason. The dress code is "smart casual", which basically means just don't dress like a homeless person. My boyfriend and I wore jeans and sweaters and were warmly welcomed by the staff. We made a reservation on their website, which was easy to navigate using Opentable. We arrived 10 minutes early, and were seated at a set table immediately.Our server was Leonardo, who was lovely. Highly knowledgeable of tea, as well as experienced in the culture of the English tradition. We perused the menu and were happy to find that they offer a fully vegan High Tea for £49 per person, which includes both sweet and savory food options along with your choice of Fortnum's famous blends or rare tea. The silver deco multi-tiered trays are replenished as you eat them, with your favorites from the selection. I loved the cucumber sandwiches and the fruit scones the best, especially with their house made lemon curd and strawberry jam. Come hungry-high tea for two ended up being a surprisingly large amount of food. After finishing with the food, we ordered two additional pots of tea, which ended up being our two favorites-The Vanilla Nougat, which tasted like smooth caramel and milk chocolate, and their signature Fortmason, a subtly floral tea smelling of orange blossom. I also enjoyed the Royal Blend, which paired nicely with the food. All of their teas are available for purchase on the 1st floor if you'd like to take some home or as a gift. I highly recommend afternoon tea at the Diamond Parlor for both locals or visitors to London.

wwlkyprpyQ-NoHI5lij1ew.text: We made a reservation for a special occasion. However, the hostess (Eugenia?) did not check us in correctly and gave us a table not in the best location when we requested to be closer to the piano. Staff is pleasant but make sure the hostess checks you in properly. Overall a very nice ambience and experience. Everything was delicious, waiter was very sweet but disappointed with the hostess. Maybe because we are asian she sat us in the back with the other asian folks who knows. Possibly a coincidence. She also made sure to show us the menu price somewhat implying that we couldn't afford to be here? We got the afternoon tea and savory - the countess grey was delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom

CsFgx6-5NIjlnRc8NJDmUg.text: I had one day in London. Every time I travel solo, I try to book an activity or a dinner reservation for each day so I make sure I get out of the hotel room (introvert problems). For London, I booked afternoon tea at Fortnum and Mason, and I was completely dazzled.The tea salon is on the top floor of what I can only describe as a tea department store, including home goods and beauty products. I was pretty tired after a day of exploring the city, so after climbing a few flights, I took the elevator up to the 5th floor, and was greeted by a friendly hostess, who showed me to my seat and took my coat. Everything being robin's egg blue, I felt a bit like I was having tea at Tiffany's.I had chosen F&M for my afternoon tea adventure not only because I knew they had delicious teas, but because they have a vegan option for the food. Three tiers of finger sandwiches, scones, and desserts, all vegan! For two hours, I sipped tea and nibbled away, delighted by everything I tasted. I loved the grilled corguettes with tarragon pesto sandwich, and the grilled peppers with hummus. The scones are what blew me away. I don't ever remember having such delicious scones, but I definitely haven't had ones these good since going vegan. They're amazing! Buttery with a perfect crumb. I topped them with vegan butter and blueberry jam.The dangers of unlimited refills, I filled up on scones before I could even get to the desserts. It was worth it, especially when they brought out hot scones fresh from the oven. I died.Seeing my defeat, my lovely waiter offered to pack up the desserts for me, and included a few more scones for me to enjoy for breakfast the next morning. Amazing.Knowing I couldn't take it with me, I had to at least taste the raspberry panacotta. One bite turned into two and before I knew it, it had been devoured. In my defense, it was light as air, and topped with a rose petal. How was I supposed to resist something topped with a rose petal? I'm only human.For the tea, I enjoyed the Royal Blend and the Earl Grey Classic. I ended up purchasing a container of Royal Blend tea as a souvenir, it was so lovely and smooth.Every detail felt luxurious, and to have a vegan afternoon tea in London was worth every pound I had to fork over (and every pound I'm sure I gained). I'm already dreaming of bringing my mom or my best friend to London so we can have an afternoon tea together!

photos.caption: Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom. Vegan scones...with a side of vegan butter! Best scones I have ever had. Be sure to try them while they're still warm!
Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom. Vegan tea cakes and desserts. The raspberry panacotta was amazing!

ifapTindHhkvAB_Daz7kLw.text: When in London, having an afternoon high tea is a must! I decided to come here on my trip to London as several of my friends recommended this place. It is royal warranted by the Queen and Prince of Wales, and is one of the most iconic afternoon high teas you can have in London. The price is a bit steep if you walk in, but I did a bit of research and got a better deal by purchasing vouchers through Virgin Experience online. It's 96 pounds for two people and you get complimentary champagne! We also found a discount code online which took another 25% off!Now about the afternoon tea experience. We made reservations so we didn't have to wait. Once we got seated, our server came to explain the menu and recommended that we order one sweet and one savoury tea set so we can have more variety. You can request seconds for anything you finished and would like more. There's also a cake table on the middle of the room where you can help yourself to some cake. Honestly, the tea sets itself were already enough food. We couldn't finish everything but we can pack the remainder to go. I really enjoyed the scones, the lemon curd and strawberry jams. The sandwiches were alright and overall the food was decent but not out of this world (probably 4 stars) but my review is 5 stars because of the experience and service. I can try one tea and then switch to another tea if I didn't like it. There's live music - someone playing piano. I can even pack the cans of jams to go. We were never rushed and can pretty much take our time and enjoy ourselves. After we were done eating, we headed down to the ground floor to purchase some tea and biscuits to take home as souvenirs. The whole place was like afternoon tea heaven. This was one of my favourite parts of the trip!

Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom

Ag9szlkXTMJWQ2p43fh9PQ.text: Hubby and I each picked a place for afternoon tea during our trip to London. This was the place hubby picked to visit for afternoon tea. On March 1, 2012 her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II visited F&M to open the Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon. This place was opened to celebrate her reign and for her to inspect the products to celebrate this special occasion. Location: The Jubilee Tea Salon is located on the fourth floor of Fortnum and Mason. The design team David Collins Studio acclaim the interior is to imitate a Georgian drawing room with subtle architectural reminders of Fortnum's early days in the 1700s. During Christmas they incorporate the F&M Jubilee Tea Salon colors into the Christmas decorations which are very elegant and tasteful. Reservations: Recommended 1-2 weeks in advance for weekdays and 4-6 weeks in advance for weekends. Many tourist we saw got turned away due to not having a reservation and were told to eat downstairs. It seems required.Dress code: "Elegance is key". I would say Business smart/casual to business formal. Though some people do dress up a bit more for special occasions such as birthdays and anniversaries. Cost: It is a elegant and refined place to enjoy afternoon tea. With its iconic eau de nil and white decor. Standard afternoon tea is 49p and with a savory/rare tea option is 53p. You can add champagne for 12.5p per glass or a tea tasting experience for 12.5p per table. Time: F&M Jubilee Tea Salon offers all day dining Monday-Saturday 11:30 -9:30 pm and Sunday 12-6pm. Tea: The selection of 79 teas each uniquely has its own history and journey providing the aroma and taste such as the boiling temperature. With one's selection of tea, there is a choice between their standard selection and rare tea selection. Tea is a product that F&M has taken seriously since the beginning of their history. In 1720 they purchased a 301lbs of Bohea tea from the East India Company for 15 shillings a pound. Food: Accompanying one's tea is the selection of beautiful bites from their afternoon tea menu options. I opted for the standard afternoon tea and my husband the savory afternoon tea. They do offer high tea, Children Menus or Gluten, Dairy, Vegetarian & Vegan Menus. All of the menus can be found on their website. With any selection you are free to also sample items from the cake carriage. Also for men, the food is unlimited :P. Service: Outstanding. The staff are professional, friendly, and knowledgeable. From our hostess who helped answers on our way out of how to get back to our hotel, to our waiter. I had no idea what to order as it was my first time.  Our waitress helped me choose what would suit my palette best. In addition she was extremely friendly and helped take pictures of hubby and I to commemorate our visit. This was our favorite location to enjoy afternoon tea. It felt classic, elegant, and relaxing. If you are a tourist, I feel this is an excellent place to pick for afternoon tea. One can shop before and / or after your visit for afternoon tea. The dress code is practical and time efficient with not having to go home to change into a suit or dress(and heels). Its relatively private, quiet, and relaxing from the hectic London while sightseeing especially (running from attraction to attraction -trying to see as much as possible). The price is reasonable and has something for everyone of all ages. Lastly, enough food for the guys (unlimited). Also, in Christmas time there is ice skating for the kids on the other side of the building. They can go ice skating while the parents come up here for some afternoon tea. Highly recommend.

tO9Zevqd9lC7wZg_5zM8YQ.text: What a treat! One thing we absolutely wanted to do on our anniversary trip while in London was have a traditional high tea - and, boy - this is the place to do it.So much tea - so many goodies to eat, and exceptional, personal service.You're seated in a charming dining room on the 4th floor and window seats overlook the passers-by down below. It's a lovely setting and the food and ambiance are exceptional.It's a bit pricey, sure - but this is a unique and fantastic dining experience for any out-of-towner to try. I would definitely go again - whenever I find myself in London.

UhGtOX7yM8zyDmy2sBV9aA.text: Make reservation. They won't seat you even if you are there and there are tables available. The hostess gave me a card and told me that I must call to make reservation. It's more about the experience than the taste. It's good to give it a try. But one time is enough.

cY4fKijHQJFyrctGC2eMfA.text: we went for the high tea and were very happy with the hot dish followed by scones and cakes.  service was really good.  tea selection was extensive and the server was very helped us narrow down our choice.fortnum's green EVERYWHERE paired with white.  very similar to tiffany's robin's egg blue but more green...and it's pretty cool to have a shade of green named after the store even if it's not officially recognized.  what color would you like to have named for you?

3YgHomgHLgftqZT0PlyJsA.text: I always come here for tea when I'm in London.  Service is pretty good, if you get the waiter's attention from the beginning.  Decor is exactly what you would for expect of an English tea house.  There's live piano at certain times of the day.  Food is good.  I always get the savory tea and mean to try the traditional one too.  Staff has great tea recommendations and let you try as many kinds as you like.  They also let you have more of whatever item you want.

g-mDAzYt-u7JgEHSzK_-rQ.text: Put those pinkies up people! Although I have been to London before and have experienced both the fancy and the casual cream tea affair, Bob had yet to experience the joy of scones and a delicious cup of tea. We looked online at the London Tea Guild's website and found that Fortnum and Mason received excellent reviews. We were able to get a reservation that was more around the lunch hour than the regular "tea time" because they are packed around the holidays.The tea room itself is very... blue. The color is everywhere and it does feel a bit like Tiffany's when you walk in. Aside from the color, it is a very formal feeling affair but no snobbery to speak of. The service was impeccable. Our server was knowledgeable and friendly and walked us through their GIGANTIC tea menu and the different options they had available. We decided to opt for the cream tea and their savory tea options with the traditional Fortnum tea blend. The cream tea was wonderful! All of the sandwiches were delightful and the scones... MY GOD THE SCONES! They were phenomenal. I would have taken 10 and just stuffed them in my purse if it was socially appropriate to do so. The clotted cream and jam was also fantastic - probably the best strawberry jam I have had in a while. The savory tea was also great - wonderful cheese and ham scones with basil cream cheese! The only downside was the dessert from the cream tea. It was not great. The desserts were a little dry and VERY sweet. The dessert from the dessert cart was also a little too sweet for my liking... but everything else was delicious! Overall, this is a wonderful (albeit quite touristy) thing to do - but still something fun to experience and quite tasty! So raise those pinkies high people and enjoy!

j1TcuWVnAO826BxoI3TemQ.text: If you are looking for a beautiful ambiance and atmosphere for afternoon tea in London and for a more affordable price, look no further. I am so glad I went with the Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon at Fortnum and Mason for our afternoon tea experience. We ordered the regular afternoon tea on the menu which includes the traditional fare with a lot of options for the value. Also included cake or another dessert which we barely had room for! The only complaint I would say from dining here was that my husband noticed a foul odor of fish when we walked in the room. Smoked salmon sandwiches are on the menu so it could be due to this. However, I did not see this as detracting from the many positives and spectacular atmosphere and tea experience. Make reservations online!

03meHJN5RYCBbOqk4x2S5A.text: We had a lovely high tea experience! Our first in England. We've had tea a few times in Boston, but this was quite the experience! I am gluten free and they really accommodate that well! We left stuffed with so many delicious treats! The finger sandwiches were a little bland. Not sure if that's because they were GF. Service was excellent! The room was beautiful!

nE-oNWWnjn03IofTEvBV1w.text: It was great! Now this is not a cheap place, but you get for what you paid for! This place is so clean, service is absolutely great (our server was Jonathan and he was awesome - he made it even better!), food is good, and tea is great! This is a tea Salon, not a restaurant or a bar or a coffee shop. TEA is the main deal... Please, remember that :) Greta selection - better to pay extra and get top tea (it is worth it). If you really want a English TEA experience I highly recommend this place.

I5-om9B_oiK0pSoWnHFpJA.text: The afternoon tea at Fortnum and Mason's Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon was hands down, the best I've EVER had! I ordered the gluten free option, while my tea-mate ordered the regular. Let me explain to you why you shouldn't over think whether or not to go to F&M over somewhere else for their gluten free tea...BECAUSE F&M IS THE BEST! We both had the exact same sandwiches (except mine was on lovely gluten free breads that were moist and didn't fall apart), warm scones (my tea-mate claimed that the gluten free scones were even better than the regular scones...wonderful texture and didn't crumble), and the gluten free pastries on the top layer (chocolate cupcake, macaroon, pound cake, and something else lovely). Absolutely, I cannot claim that any other tea room comes even close to the quality of F&M's gluten free tea snacks. The teas were also magnificent (we loved the Countess Grey, jasmine pearls, and the darjeelings). The service was so incredibly friendly, and they made us feel welcome to request more of anything we liked on the tea snack platter. Just to drive this point that the F&M gluten free menu was amazing...I recently went for afternoon tea at a different highly regarded tea room...and I was heavily disappointed with the sorbet and fruit platter that was the replacement for pastries, and amuse bouche spoons that were filled with sandwich filling...COME ON! Why can't everyone else take a pointer from F&M and make some real gluten free options rather than just deleting the breads and pastries!!!Since our return from London, I have tried to make us afternoon tea...but we will always remember and look forward to our return to F&M.***I uploaded a picture of the gluten free platter so you can see for yourself that you get REAL scones, sandwiches, and pastries!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom. gluten free on the left (yes! sandwiches, scones, and pastries!!!)...and regular on the right :0)

VMibP_5ZjJX-uxK6_JkoWA.text: This is definitely something you should experience if you are visiting London. True, there are a lot of cheaper high tea places even outside of London...and Fortnum and Mason seems to be quite touristy due to its association with the royal family, but you simply can't beat the experience.We ordered the tea service. Unlike some other places, you are not allowed to share tea services (they charge by head), as you get unlimited refills on the food. May I suggest that you come hungry?It's a three tier tea service -- you get cakes and pastries on the top, scones on the middle, and sandwiches on the bottom. The sandwiches were fantastic -- even the humble cucumber sandwich was done really, really well. The cakes and pastries were really good as well -- I would have destroyed them if I wasn't sick and had a reduced appetite. However, the scones disappointed me, as I've definitely had better elsewhere (Mandarin Oriental has spectacular scones), but the jam and clotted cream saved them somewhat.I've had better tea service elsewhere, but none of them have service that is quite as English-style as it is here. But be warned... Be on your best behaviour here! They don't seem to tolerate much touristy bullshit. My friend who appeared late got her own food, but since I could not finish my tea service at all, she took some of the sandwiches and started eating (without asking, but we are on share-all-food terms ;). We weren't going to get seconds, but our waitress might have been a bit distressed by us...

IbgV_rzQRPu3a1rbyGkczw.text: Can't really say 'I've experienced better' since this is the only formal British tea I've had.  The tea and service were delightful, but the food was so rich that it was hard to eat it.  The term 'cloying' comes to mind.

4fFdzn9a77upW31lUzgnzw.text: What a blast!! Afternoon tea exceeded expectations. Atmosphere is relaxed (not stuffy at all!), you can try as many teas as you'd like, and order unlimited refills of your favorite sandwiches and treats. They even sent us home with scones and jam on the house. I agonized over where to have one "fancy" afternoon tea during our trip to London and I am so glad we decided on Fortnum & Mason.

WEbGc3UVLEXSQsYLnVI0mg.text: The Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon on the fourth floor of Fortum & Mason was opened by HM The Queen. The restaurant is very elegant, calm, and tranquil.  It was nice to relax and chill while a rain storm passed through the city. The fresh plain & fruit scones, served with clotted cream and your choice of Fortum & Mason preserves, where fantastic. I had the Fortnum's High Tea and chose the Lobster Omelette Victoria with Lobster Bisque and Truffle. The tea cakes had individual patisserie and a choice of one selection from the cake cart. My favorite treats where the rose éclair and the coconut mango macaron. The fresh berry sponge was very moist. I would prefer fresh lemon curd at a tea, but Fortnum & Mason's packaged lemon curd with free range egg and Sicilian lemon juice is very yummy.  They offer an extensive choice of Fortnum's famous blends or rare teas.  My only criticism was the service. Our waiter left for a long period of time for a cigarette break (You could smell it when he returned.) He left three tables mid-service without coverage.  We sat with empty plates and tea pots and looked at each other as we waited for his return. Reservations are highly recommended. Book the classic English afternoon tea on-line at fortumandmason.com; opentable.co.uk.; or reservations@fortnumandm… Gift cards are also available.

qClaoVezTzjngibmNMSF6Q.text: The day had finally arrived when we would be going to Fortum and Masons for afternoon tea. Celebrating a friends birthday was the occasion. Situated on the 4th floor we were greeted by a lady behind a reception desk and a pianist tinkerling the ivories. Coats were taken and after short while we were whisked through the tea room to our table. A gorgeous afternoon tea set was set out and we were given a couple of menus - one food and another teas - 85 in total! Wow wee! After choosing our menu of choice we took in the surroundings. This place loses a star for the service being slow. I know it's afternoon tea why the need to rush, but I was gasping for a cup of tea! Our tea trays then arrived with sandwiches, homemade jams and conserves and sweet pastries. Every morsel was delicious and a dessert tray featured in the centre of the room if you were able to squeeze in more cake! The experience as a whole was good, but I've had better! Tourists also grace this place with their rucksacks (yes I am a snob) so if you want a sophisticated experience then you may wish to go elsewhere.Doggie bags were kindly given for the treats we didn't eat.

9oDtRFQXKkqLRTuDXi-C3g.text: Brought my mom and dad here when I was living in London and this was the first stop on their trip.  Posh and elegant - and a must visit for anyone who likes the English afternoon tea experience.  My parents were born in a British colony, so Fortnum and Mason was a pilgrimage of sorts for them.  The service here is amazing, the food is exquisite, and the tea is second to none.  One tip - be properly dressed for the occasion.

qRByTLN59sujjbNBN7ooPw.text: Come here for a perfect example of afternoon tea - a giant assortment of teas, options for high tea or afternoon tea, and excellent service.  We were promptly seated and our waiter was so polite and explained everything to us.I started with the countess grey tea, which by the way is now my new favorite tea.  A mix of earl grey and orange pekoe, it already smells good before you even drink it.  It's nice too that with the tea, they have strainers and you can try as many or as little teas as you want during the meal.  I also tried the wedding breakfast blend that was created to celebrate Will and Kate's wedding.  A delicious breakfast tea also with some orange pekoe but not as good as the Countess Grey.  The tea list itself is pages and pages, so I would definitely want to come back and try more!We opted for the savory afternoon tea, which comes with savory scones and finger sandwiches.  When the items first arrived I thought we would still be hungry but it was all quite filling.  You can also ask for more if there are some sandwiches or scones that you have a liking to.  The finger sandwiches include cucumber, chicken, smoked salmon, prawn, and chicken (which almost has a curry taste to it).  The dessert table had a large selection - I opted for a raspberry sponge cake and my boyfriend got the flourless chocolate cake.  I thought my cake was very tasty, and my boyfriend said that his chocolate cake was the best he's ever had.  We would definitely come back for another amazing experience next time we're in London!

NtEZMKFfATELzE0WfYAalg.text: The factor that really affected the overall experience was the large group.  They were loud and taking flash photos the entire time they were there.  They were also rather demanding on the waitstaff (1 person for our entire section).  Because of all of this, the atmosphere and service suffered significantly.I'm not sure if I would recommend going, but I can't fully discredit them either.  I would just hope that you aren't seated in a section with a large group.

TMwoGXkhf-9xvFwFgY_l-g.text: Unfortunately I was quite disappointed with the experience. I have tried many afternoon teas including the ones in Harrods and The Dorchester for example and the food was much better. The sandwiches were very bland and I did give the food allergy notice in advance hoping that they would make a bit more variety but they didn't we were just given 2 types of sandwich, the tea was very normal, nothing special. The scones were quite hard and they only had minima variety of jams available. The little pastries that come with the afternoon tea were really not tasty at all. Their macarons are not good, they tasted quite buttery unlike Laduree, the banana loaf cake was also hard it did not melt in the mouth. Overall, it is not worth the £50 per person that was spent here, would rather go for a nice meal elsewhere and buy lots of macarons from Laduree. Not value for money at all, I was upset and disappointed.

4YGHiBiFsh7SJrakTTcHDQ.text: A wonderful tea experience! I read reviews regarding what to wear but when we reached the tea room they said sneakers and jeans were entirely tolerable.  They said to be advised if you go to the Ritz but they are quite flexible.Adorable tea service for my toddler - no teapot but fresh juice instead.Our adult tea was sublime.  Curry chicken sandwiches were my favorite of the savory (mild but very tasty). Scones with clotted cream and jam were purrrrrfect! I feel the sweet cakes don't get any attention and you are happy with the previous 2.  I noticed so many people barely touched the top tier of sweets! Tea is better than expected. Teavista (expert) was worth the extra money.Service is awesome.  They anticipated just about any need/want we had.Originally made reservations at the Dorchester but so glad we changed given a recommendation from a friend.Consider this your recommendation to go whenever you can!

YE8l8jb5TRUD-ty9tTf4ew.text: Fortnum and Mason is an institution in London and what better place to enjoy the fine English tradition of afternoon tea than the tea salon located in this beautiful store. The tea room is very elegant and the fine china are all in the very pleasant bluish green color. They offer several kinds of full set afternoon teas, some a combo of sweet and savory and one savory only. My friend and I both ordered the afternoon tea which offers the most variety. Of course, we mustn't forget about the tea. You can choose from several pages of Fortnum and Mason specialty tea.The food came in a 3-tier tower: the lowest tier were an assortment of dainty finger sandwiches, the middle tier were a couple of scones and the top tier were some very nice looking desserts. I was mostly excited about the desserts, but decided to eat my way up. I was secretly deciding to ask for a second chocolate dessert thing before I even started. You see, it is all you can eat and you need to plan ahead. However, I felt stuffed at scone level already. I pushed myself to take a couple of bites of each dessert and then I admitted defeat. It is a good way to spending a rainy afternoon catching up with good friends. However, make sure you have your credit card ready, because this is not cheap.

Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom. High tea tower

F-eO5rdyOB1OgH-imgsf4Q.text: Definitely a good place to hang out with friends and family who crave for an elegant, luxurious afternoon tea. Great scones and jams. Teas appointed by the Queen are really my flavours!!
