eL_5Xhpqn1WAJlCAaw1SDw.text: Is there any better place to enjoy an afternoon tea then in F&M in London. That was such an amazing experience. It's a very fancy place, beautiful tea sets, great tea and food and an excellent service.  You feel like you are in a different world.  Piece full, classy, with a soft piano background music. At the end we went to the store and got ourselves some tea and gifts for friend here in USA. Absolutely enjoyed time there and would love to go back

photos.caption: Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom. tea sets
Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom. Christmas decorations at F&M
Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom. F&M at Christmas

c_q7Suh0pXNJW4oMIGVcFw.text: During our London trip, I was looking forward to afternoon tea and all of its fanciness.  I had absolutely no idea where to get tea, if you needed reservations, how dressed up you had to be, etc. A friend of mine who had more of an insight recommended Fortnum and Mason for high tea.  So glad we went!First, the gals at the front desk greeted us, took our coats, and led us to our table.  We opted for the high priced high tea menu, which included a small entree instead of the regular finger sandwiches that are offered with other tea menus.  My husband and I chose the London smoked salmon.  Delicious.  Nice and delicate, while meaty enough to be filling.  Our friend ordered the lobster omelette victoria.  The eggs were nice and fluffy, while also being filling.The rest of the tea goodies included scones (regular and raisen) and a variety of desserts.  Side note...if you still have room in your belly, you can ask for more of any of the scones and desserts for free!  I will say that I was very happy with the scones, especially since I had them with the greatest jams ever (raspberry, apricot, and my favorite lemon curd).  They were also served with clotted cream, which is kinda like butter in it's smoothness but without the intense richness.The desserts looked incredible, but I was a smidge disappointed in the taste.  The plum macaron had a crunchy cookie and there was too much filling.  The chocolate cake with gold leaf was intensely rich.  There was a marshmallowy cup type dessert that didn't live up to my s'mores expectations.  The one dessert that I was over the moon for was the mocha/lemon/rice krispy type layered cake.  I can't tell you what it was called, but it was delicious!So the whole point of afternoon tea is the tea, of course.  Each of us had 3 different types of tea.  There is a menu of about 80 different teas, so it was definitely overwhelming.  I like the fruity teas myself, so I opted for the green tea with apple (light), black tea with strawberry (darker), and black tea with peach (darker).  All were delicious, but the green tea with apple was probably my favorite because of the lighter consistency.This place is a pretty penny definitely, but the experience is incredible.  The service is top notch!

photos.caption: Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom. Makes you feel fancy.
Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom. Desserts...they look better than they taste.
Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom. Smoked salmon

DUSBhwOf4PnBJVhUIVIY3w.text: Very Nice afternoon tea. The sandwiches were good (esp smoked salmon one) but they were not very forthcoming with replenishing them. Cakes were delicious. I particularly liked the lemon meringue one. The highlight were the scones though - the clotted cream and jam were delicious. Lemon curd also flavorful and tart.

photos.caption: Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom. Cakes!

1ZfK1YFRRJ0GPaG9KkY0NQ.text: not worth the money. the after noon tea was really not good, with little desserts. not so good finger sandwiches and scones.

s_Hi3G3A5onuCkiF_rgWVw.text: Afternoon tea at Fortnum and Mason was one of the highlights of the trip me and my husband recently took to London! We arrived without a reservation, and only had to wait a few minutes for a table to be prepared for us (though it was busy there - I imagine in busier tourist times like the height of summer a reservation may be needed to ensure you can have tea at your preferred time). I am pregnant, so once we sat down, we asked a few questions about items being pasteurized and also substituting some of the savory items on the classic tea to ensure I could eat everything.  The servers were very helpful with providing information and offering alternative options. They even pointed me towards the herbal teas section of the menu to ensure I knew these were the decaffeinated teas available. When we asked for certain items to be refreshed, the substituted items were properly substituted again without us needing to ask or say something, which I appreciated. The food and tea on the whole were excellent and plentiful. As mentioned in other reviews, all the items can be refreshed, so this tea can really be made into a full meal. The ability to try different teas was really nice - I tried two of the herbal teas and my husband tried two of the black teas and one herbal tea. Overall, we enjoyed all of them, and the server was helpful in offering suggestions or clarifying details of the teas when we asked.I removed one star from my review as we did have a few minor hiccups in service, specifically when asking for a refresh on some items. It took ~20 minutes for a new pot of tea for my husband at one point and also for some additional small desert items to arrive. However, when we followed up with our server to ask where these items were, she was apologetic and brought them right away. On the whole, the service was excellent and the servers regularly asked about what else they could bring us, even packing up and sending us home with a couple of items from the desert cart as we were too full to eat any more while we were there! We also never felt rushed during our tea, even though were were at our table for over 2 hours.I highly recommend Fortnum and Mason if you are looking for a more upscale afternoon tea option. It is a bit pricy, but I really felt that it is a worthwhile cost for what you get - good service, excellent food, great atmosphere. I plan to go back on my next trip to London!

oSXatrdBGVTxE8Y9q-sD2w.text: I have been to tea in the Fortnum and Mason: DIamond Jubilee Tea Salon twice and both times have been absolutely flawless. From the moment you walk out of the elevator into the light blue lobby of the restaurant, you are met with soft music and elegance. It's a fairy-tale setting for a very special meal. The service here is exemplary. On our last visit, they had trouble finding our reservation but handled it without a hitch, seating us regardless. Our waiter answered any and all of our tea-novice questions, with a smile. The Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon is not cheap by any stretch of the imagination, but the experience of dining in such a special and elegant setting is definitely worth it. I was lucky enough to be brought here by family on their visits to London, and it is a beautiful place to celebrate a special occasion. I have tried both the standard and savoury teas and they are both stunning. If you are eating with a friend, I highly suggest getting one of each (as you are able to order unlimited refills of all items served) so that you can try everything! The sandwiches are perfect (try not to fill up on them) and the sweet and savoury pastries are very delicious. It is impossible not to leave here stuffed...but make sure to take some Victoria sponge to go!!

photos.caption: Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom. Sandwiches
Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom. Savoury tea

gUyXXS5ab1UuwQ22JlUVug.text: Food and tea is fine. Not impressive for the price. I believe there is dress code but not strictly enforced. I saw quite a few groups of people wearing t shirts and sandals which I definitely won't considered as "smart casual".  The service was bad for one specific waiter (others seem to be fine) but that ruins our experience. The waiter didn't ask what we would like to drink in the beginning. We added Champagne and water later on and he didn't bother to ask us what type of champagne or water we would like. He assumed the Champagne we would like and bring it to us directly. The explanation of the difference of the tea is also unprofessional as if we are not worth his time for the explanation.Besides this specific waiter, the experience overall is ok. If you don't mind a tourist hype kind of place, might worth visiting once. I personally wouldn't come back again.

XBszIaVqY3PaD5ApFbS17Q.text: Definitely worth the splurge. At £40-44 per person, I had high hopes and I'm happy to say that my expectations were met. Though my mother and I dressed up a little bit, my dad dropped the ball and had a t-shirt and hoodie (luckily pants and not jeans). However, this did not affect the service and they treated us well. I went with the High Tea Menu and my parents went with the Savoury and Afternoon Tea Menus. Mine came with a choice of appetizers, and I chose eggs benedict. Though it looked a bit uninteresting, the egg was poached perfectly and the sauce was good; a pretty solid version of the classic. My parents both had finger sandwiches with theirs and our server mentioned that the sandwiches could be refilled. But we were ready to move onto the good stuff.The teas themselves were excellent. I started with Smoky Earl Grey, which was lovely. Later on, our server recommended the Lapsang Suchong, which was even better. Then the three-tiered dessert stands arrived. The sweets were all very nice but I felt the scones and savouries were the show-stoppers. The clotted cream and lemon curd were delicious and the scones were warm and really just perfect. My favourite piece from the savoury tray was oeuf drumkilbo; an egg with the top cut off and served with crab and caviar. I'm not ashamed to say that I asked for two more. Coming in second was the crab vol au vent and trout mousse on almond shortbread. For the sweets, I mostly enjoyed the rose éclair and the macaron. We also asked for 'refills' of those, and our server offered to just bring a whole new plate of desserts for us. She was very kind and didn't make us feel bad for wanting more. Now we had been there for just short of 2 hours, so we felt we should go even though no one was rushing us out of the door. But you also get a slice of cake from the cake carriage! We were already quite full by then and were about to pass, but then our server offered to box up a slice of each cake for us! Along with the cakes, she boxed up ALL of our leftovers with care, even the lemon curd and unopened jam. Unfortunately she didn't included the clotted cream for whatever reason, but that was probably good since I would have eaten it straight out of the cup with a spoon.. This was totally worth the price and I can highly recommend it. Just make reservations when you can; I saw several parties being turned away as they were fully booked at 4pm on a Wednesday.

JfP6MPvzQrlCMgx-Uf0Fow.text: If you are a craving a traditional afternoon tea experience and yet don't want to blow through your entire vacation savings, this is definitely a place to go.  Not only is it an amazing tea and biscuits store, there's also an upstairs tea room where you can sample a wide variety of tea, miniature sandwiches, not to mention to die-for scones.  The live music on the grand piano makes it all very posh:)  While my husband and I are no strangers to exuberant and interesting tea rooms, this was a first time for our six year old son.  Although he came in thinking it would be too "girly"and that he isn't a big tea drinker, he fell absolutely in love with it and it became one of the highlights of his trip to London.  The staff was exceptionally nice to him and went out of their way to accommodate everyone in our party.I highly recommend the following:1.  Make a reservation ahead of time.  2.  Don't wear jeans and shorts.  The staff won't say anything but you can see from their glances that they don't approve.Grade A++++++++

dxxByQ3qcIDr4ZNLjjua4g.text: Had tea here with the wife a week ago.I was a little apprehensive at first, due to the cost (forty pounds per person plus the service charge), and after reading some of the reviews online... but we had a great time.The menu is vast, and they have a special diabetic menu, allow you to select meals instead of high tea, and even have savory tea, and a gluten free menu, amongst other items.The place is big, and only a few tables were seated when we walked in.  By the end of the meal, most of the tables were occupied.Once they seated us, they gave us a few mins with the menu, and then the waitress came over and helped go over a few questions we had.My wife ordered the Eggs Benedict, which came with tea (organic earl grey), and the scones and sweets.  I ordered the savory afternoon tea, with the chai.Sandwiches were really good.  I wasn't thrilled with the tea, as it wasn't strong enough for me... they took it back and made it stronger.  This was a little better.  A little while later, they came to replenish my tea.. and i asked them to change it to another one.  they were very accommodating.When i finished my sandwiches, they asked if i wanted any more... and how could i refuse.The sandwiches came in a set of five... Salmon, egg salad, chicken salad, cucumber and cheese and ham.  My favorite was the chicken salad... so they gave extra of that one.The savory tower was also nice... savory scones and other items.  There was a goat cheese item that was also great, along with a chicken pastry.They even packed all of the leftovers, and gave us the 2 bottles of jam that came with my wife's tea.Best part of the meal was the service.  Friendly and professional.. that made the meal worth it, and made for a memorable experience.I would recomend them to anyone looking for an exceptional place for tea in London.

YGzcuxAfnpamz51ZH1jjzA.text: I'm a pretty standard Royal Blend tea drinker - its basic but delicious. The clotted cream and scones are divine! And even though I err on the side of vegetarian... their coronation chicken sandwich is out of this world! Absolutely adore coming here for tea

evARTtCS7304YrFzAshx5g.text: Fortnum and Masons tea was good. But I was expecting FANTASTIC OUT OF THIS WORLD so maybe thats why I was a little disappointed. The service wasn't fantastic - I had booked in advance as I had family visiting and was left waiting for about 45 minutes for our table. The desserts were ok, but maybe I had too high expectations. Nevertheless I have given them 3 stars (really, 3.5) for a few reasons.1. Although I preferred the Scones at Browns (these are the only 2 High Teas I've had in London, mind you), the sandwiches were DELICIOUS, like, I could not put them down. They were SO SO good. I would come back just for them, hah!2. Although the staff looked super pissed off, when we asked if we could take home the remains of our tea, we were surprised to find that they had gift wrapped everything in beautiful takeout boxes, and had even given us the remaining jars of jam! I guess they couldn't really have given it to anyone else as all the jars on your table are new.. but I'm talking full on, real life size jam jar! I guess it is a pretty pricey meal but, I thought it was a nice gesture anyway.But yes, 3 (point 5) stars for the sandwiches! And the pretty interior.

Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom

K9219B7p3C_KGAHg-GMibQ.text: This afternoon tea concept is a new one to me, so when I was planning out food options for a trip to London, it seemed like the perfect opportunity to have an authentic experience. If it's good enough for the Queen, then it's certainly good enough for me!Be sure to make a reservation. I saw a few people get denied at the door because they were fully booked on a Sunday afternoon. You'll also want to check in your coats and bags! There's no need for them during your time here. Keep your camera for pictures though. We had a massive backpack that we checked and we're happy that we did as it would have looked really out of place in the dining room. Both the savory and sweet afternoon teas are delicious. Try to order one of each set so you can sample everything. Each plate level is replenishable, so by all means, go for it if your stomach capacity permits.This was a great part of the trip since it gave us an opportunity to relax and chill out a bit before going hard out on the town. It's also fun to walk around Fortnum and Mason afterwards and try to exercise off some of those tea sandwiches and scones!

Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom. Sweet on the left, savory on the right

zvmKI32iEj-uxqRVQhBZRA.text: I wish there were more places like this in SF. It's a place where I can take my girl friends or my mother to enjoy little luxury. A place where I can escape from reality, pretend that I have nothing to do with the busy world outside, and just relax with the live piano in the background while appreciating the delicate tea sets. I especially love their scones,  they were warm, soft and flaky. The cream and jam it came with were exquisite. The savory afternoon tea set was very good as well, I like almost every piece of their mini sandwiches. We ordered cakes in addition to the high tea sets, the cakes was absolutely delicious (and so pretty to look at!). Don't underestimate the portion though, we came with empty stomaches and almost couldn't finish everything. It is a little pricy, but you get the service, ambiance and deliciousness you pay for!

photos.caption: Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom. savory tea

WWq4T-urhygzgArT-3J1YQ.text: When you visit a restaurant where the afternoon/high teas start at £44.00 per person, you expect a lot.  Without question.  Yes, there's a difference between afternoon and high tea (google it).  Plus, there are 2 types of afternoon tea (savoury and sweet).  There's also a 12.5% gratuity automatically added to the bill.We went on a Monday afternoon, and although I'd made a reservation, there was no need.  We were sitted next to a window, and a note on their website says that they can't guarantee that.  However, I don't think it's a big deal.  The view out of the window is of the neighbouring office block.  It's not spectacular at all.The menu can be confusing to some people.  You can get endless refills of the food and tea if you want.  You can request a tea sampling if you want.  You can get a free dessert if you want.  All of this isn't explained that well on the menu and to some people, this matter can cause a certain discomfort.Our waiters were a bit disappointing.  One of them poured the black tea in before the milk (the milk should be poured in first as that reduces the risk of the bone china cups cracking because of the hot tea).  One waiter didn't tell us where the dessert station was, and I had to stand up, and walk around trying to find it.  One of the tea caddies had faded colouring on it.  Normally, these matters don't matter so much, but when you're paying over £103.00 for 2 people (as I did), then you expect something close to perfection.  These small issues were matters that could easily have been avoided, and weren't due to a jammed packed restaurant, short staff, or matters that the restaurant had no control over.At restaurants like this, it's not unreasonable to expect the staff to almost have the ability to predict what the clients need and want.  After all, the staff are there every day, and should have a good idea of the wants and needs of the clients.  Many people (me included), don't go to restaurants like this that often, and to a degree, we need some sort of guidance on how to go about things.So, that's why I'm giving it only 4 stars.  The food and drink itself are very good, so no complaints there.It was my girlfriend's birthday and after I mentioned that, they played "Happy Birthday to you" for her.  Plus, we got a candle on her piece of cake.By the way, I'm not a snob or anything like that.  However, I did notice that some clients wore jeans.  That's fine for most occasions.  But I don't think it's appropriate for this particular restaurant.  If you're looking for a supreme and perfect experience, I find it difficult to recommend this restaurant.  Next time around, I'll try Claridge's, the Dorchester, the Ritz, or the Savoy.  But maybe they're all the same.

Ck2i21E71nN6mfW7CmI7-Q.text: As a first-time visitor to London, I wanted to experience a proper afternoon tea. Fortnum and Mason's Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon always came up in my searches, so we made a reservation (via OpenTable) here for 5:30pm on a Wednesday afternoon. The atmosphere in the tea salon was definitely posh with piano playing in the background and many people dressed according to the "smart casual" policy that Fortnum and Mason has. However, there were certainly a lot of people who were underdressed, wearing t-shirts with leggings, or even cheap flip flops. So while there IS a dress code, it doesn't appear to be very strictly enforced.My husband and I both opted for the regular afternoon tea which is £44 (so about $56-$60 depending on the exchange rate) per person. I regret not choosing the savoury afternoon tea because we would have had more variety then. As many other reviewers have said, you can refill the finger sandwiches, scones, sweets, and teas as needed -- you just need to ask your waiter. However, the scones and sandwiches were only mediocre. They were both dry, and no amount of clotted cream or lemon curd could cover that up.So the main reason for the 2-star rating is because the service was absolutely horrendous. Our water glasses were never refilled and we barely saw our server. We spent half an hour looking around us to see if we were able to spot our waiter so that we could get refills of our tea, water, and sandwiches. When we were finally able to get his attention, we eventually got our tea and sandwich refills maybe after another 20 minutes, but not water refills (we gave up on this because we couldn't find our waiter again). When my husband and I were ready to pay, we again could not find our waiter anywhere, and spent another half hour at our table looking around for him. We finally flagged down a waiter for another table, who helped us box up our leftover sweets and some cakes to take home. Oh - our waiter did show up at the end to present us with the bill. I would hate to think that the terrible service could be a result of my skin color or the fact that my husband and I are a mixed-race couple, but I did not notice any other tables having the same experience. In total, we spent close to 2 hours here when the time-limit is 1.5 hours, but most of it was because we were waiting for the waiter.For the price that we paid, I expected better service. The tea itself was excellent though (which is why this is not a 1-star review).

llNcjqFZgq5tPIa-ZhqpTQ.text: This is the place to go for the full experience of a true Royal British Afternoon Tea. With Royal treatment.All products with F&M quality.

Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom

9BEeZLHkH1v0hZ9Br7yVuQ.text: Fortnum and Mason has been the standard for traditional afternoon tea. If you're looking for the typical London tea experience - you have to stop by here. I wouldn't come here toooo often as it's on the high end - £40-48/person ($62-75 USD). {BOOKING}- If you're trying to get a weekend, I would suggest booking at least a month + ahead. Those Saturday afternoons are especially difficult to come by. For weekdays, a month ahead should be fine. I wouldn't even try to walk in - it's pretty packed. - You can go through OpenTable (online), or you can call (020 7734 8040). {DRESS CODE} - Smart Casual: They ask to refrain from wearing sportswear (I suppose tennis shoes etc). Was this enforced? I don't think it's strictlyy enforced but I would just try to look nice. {SERVICE}- Eh. I've had better service other places. I found it slightly difficult to get the servers attention :/. They also weren't very good at clearing off extra dishes and teapots when we started to order extra so that the table got cluttered.  {DECOR}- My mother commented that it looked like a chinese dim sum eating place .. which it did minus all the mint green colored dishes. - The porcelain dining wear ranged from looking new to so old all of the gold was rubbed off on the plates. - It's a little loud inside here with all the people eating and talking. {FOOD}- All you can eat / drink. Just call the waiter over and ask for refills on whatever you want and they'll come back with it. - They have several different set types - Afternoon Tea, High Tea & Savory Tea. Your party is allowed to order different sets and SHARE them within each other so that you can try out everything :) AND free refills! What a deal. - Parties of 3: 90 minute limit- Parties of 4+: 2 hour limit. - You're also allowed to TAKE FOOD HOME! You're only allowed to take certain types of foods home due to some code. I couldn't take anything from my savory set other than the scones. But we could take the sweets from the afternoon tea set. You can also take the lemon curd / jam that they give you for the scones as well. - I found that the selection of food here wasn't as impressive as I've had before but it's very traditional tea foods. {RECOMMENDATIONS} - If you're feeling up for eating food food - I would order a high tea set. You get to choose a main course and get scones + tea + dessert along with it. My mother got the Lobster Omelette Victoria, Lobster Bisque & Shaved Truffle - and it was delicious. She raved that this was the best dish that we've eaten so far in London and will forever remember it.. okaay. It was pretty good. - Savory Afternoon Tea: I loved the Spinach & Parmesan Tartlet. Ordered like 6. - Afternoon Tea: I found this set to be a little overly sweet for my taste. - Cake Carriage: I loved the fact that you could try traditional British cakes (Victorian Sponge, Battenburg Cake) from their selection.- The Battenburg Cake looked so pretty - It's a square shaped, checkered pink and vanilla colored cake covered all over with marzipan. Now it tasted quite nasty though - just too much marzipan and the cake was strangely sweet tasting. Taking a picture was good enough for me.

yUQX3ImGzqesZXH8I37t-A.text: Had a wonderful time with the bff here. We had a reservation but it didn't seem we needed one. Love that we shared a savory and a sweet and you're able to replenish anything you want - though what we had was more than enough for the two of us. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Fortnum and Mason: Diamond Jubilee Tea Salon - London, United Kingdom. The sweet and savory tea sets

A36r-RACSbD14Ch_pcp2iQ.text: My coworker used to live in London, so I asked her to recommend a spot for high tea, and Fortnum and Mason was on the list.  I made the reservation the day before I was about to fly out, so I wasn't able to research it much.  I've had high tea in San Francisco before, but it was nothing compared to the elegance of Fortnum and Mason.  As I walked in, I could definitely tell this was a go to spot for tea.  A few minutes after we sat down, our waitress came by to ask us if we were ready to order.  Since it was our first time there, we didn't know what to order as the menu was a bit overwhelming.  We still wanted to eat dinner later, so we didn't want to fill up too much for high tea.  My boyfriend wanted to just order a la carte, but the waitress made it seem like he had to order from one of the set menus.  When we were finally ready to order, I got the Savoury Afternoon Tea, and my boyfriend was about to order the High Tea, when the waitress told him he could order his item a la carte.  He ended up getting the Beef Wellington.  The food ended up being ok, but the service was sub par.  For the amount of money we were paying, it would've been nice if the waitress had helped us out with the menu more.  This would have made our experience much better.

3s4yjoZKIxS4NBv8qQ6fCw.text: The environment is good for afternoontea.Their tea is defiantly amazing. Their desserts were not good at all, i was expecting a high end delicious desserts were the price but they just look pricey but not tasty. They were too sweet and to the point i can even finish one tiny piece.

3FtYdmBFAShzvyy1vxQV5A.text: 2 stars is "Meh.  I've experienced better" and I think that really fits here.  We try to have traditional afternoon tea each time we visit London and this time we tried Fortnum and Mason.  I found the service to be somewhat stuffy and the food wasn't that great.  The store itself is fun but the afternoon tea left a bit to be desired.   Please don't think it is terrible, I just think there are much better places (food and atmosphere wise) to have afternoon tea.    While I'm sure it is a fluke, the lights in the ladies didn't work so we had to take care of business with the doors open.

kYop9-EwFhkwyiBdoIPJXA.text: We were initially concerned about the price (especially when you convert it to Canadian Dollars), but walked away feeling incredibly satisfied and pleased as can be.Our server was perfect and eager to take care of our allergies. She was attentive, helpful and seemed genuinely disappointed when we revealed afterwards that it was my wife's birthday and she hadn't been able to offer the usual birthday celebrations (my Wife preferred a quiet birthday). The food was of outstanding quality. Especially considering that we had to have a gluten free selection for tea. It was the first time in a long time that our allergies did not leave us feeling limited or left out.Highly recommended.

RiYpjsWZVjOIIF4mbdR7RA.text: Amazing atmosphere, food and drink. It is on the pricy side, but if you want a proper High tea that is fit for a Queen this is where you go. In fact, I was told her majesty even gets her tea here!  They have an amazing variety of teas and snacks to choose from. We decided to try a high tea and a savory. Both were good but the savory was my favorite, because it included more little tea sandwiches and bites.  Our server was amazing and made sure to refresh all of our favorite bites.
